commit_message:
Change reference to OvnDbNotifyHandler._watched_events

Since [1], RowEventHandler._watched_events do not use name mangling.
OvnDbNotifyHandler, inheriting from RowEventHandler, can access to
this variable.

[1]https://review.opendev.org/#/c/752797/

Change-Id: I545c31977799c4ea51e037b631a49306da9c4a3b
Partial-Bug: #1897928

commit_message:
Handle container launch

When we run with running natively, the execvp never returns when we
invoke the heat-all process. When we run heat-all as a container, the
container launches but the process will return back to the tripleoclient
code. We need to properly handle the fork execution.

Change-Id: I12b648931fd13e54ebae07306efaf5b615d1a178
Blueprint: switch-to-heat-all-container

commit_message:
Update heat container location

We recently renamed the container prefixes from centos-binary to
openstack. Additionally this moves the version information of this into
constants that can be updated in stable branches if needed.

Blueprint: bp/switch-to-heat-all-container
Change-Id: I208a6ae5b314e8482ca5fc8d3e5695dbd7da5f1b

commit_message:
[TRAIN ONLY] Handle empty role Specific Parameter

Having empty role specific parameters will fail the deployment as
mistral workflow YAQL expression fails.

Change-Id: I688de151c654a19003397adacf07ae67f66001a7
Closes-Bug: #1900810

[{'created': '2020-10-22 15:47:01.000000000', 'message': 'Add ssl_verify_client parameter for horizon

The recent change in puppet-horizon[1] made the ssl_verify_client
parameter mandatory when ssl_ca is set. This patch makes sure that
the ssl_verify_client parameter is set properly.

In addition, internal tls cert is not valid when internal tls is not
enabled. This patch also addresses that point, and make ssl_ca is set
only when needed.

Closes-Bug: #1900947
Change-Id: I286f69b8d3775d7538685e799f092ce47b5d75a7
'}, {'created': '2020-10-22 15:48:12.000000000', 'message': 'Add ssl_verify_client parameter for horizon

The recent change in puppet-horizon[1] made the ssl_verify_client
parameter mandatory when ssl_ca is set. This patch makes sure that
the ssl_verify_client parameter is set properly.

In addition, internal tls cert is not valid when internal tls is not
enabled. This patch also addresses that point, and make ssl_ca is set
only when needed.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/758041/6

Closes-Bug: #1900947
Change-Id: I286f69b8d3775d7538685e799f092ce47b5d75a7
'}]
commit_message:
Add ssl_verify_client parameter for horizon

The recent change in puppet-horizon[1] made the ssl_verify_client
parameter mandatory when ssl_ca is set. This patch makes sure that
the ssl_verify_client parameter is set properly.

In addition, internal tls cert is not valid when internal tls is not
enabled. This patch also addresses that point, and make ssl_ca is set
only when needed.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/758041/6

Closes-Bug: #1900947
Change-Id: I286f69b8d3775d7538685e799f092ce47b5d75a7

commit_message:
Rename NeutronMl2PluginBase TripleO service

Rename Tripleo Service for NeutronMl2PluginBase from
OS::TripleO::Docker::NeutronMl2PluginBase to match with other services
as OS::TripleO::Services::NeutronMl2PluginBase.

Change-Id: I38d2fb5e9f0daba4c519343e88cd51e07dd00300

commit_message:
[ceph-osd] Update post apply job

The PS updates wait_for_pods() function in post apply script.
The changes allow to pass wait_for_pods() function when required percent
of OSDs reached (REQUIRED_PERCENT_OF_OSDS). Also removed a part of code
which is not needed any more.

Change-Id: I56f1292682cf2aa933c913df162d6f615cf1a133

commit_message:
Remove the unused coding style modules

Python modules related to coding style checks (listed in blacklist.txt in
openstack/requirements repo) are dropped from lower-constraints.txt
they are not needed during installation.

Change-Id: Ib9998802371dafa84042e3c4c71c7fac019fe996

messages: [{'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2020-10-23 17:43:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2020-10-23 17:57:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1\n\ndnm'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-23 17:43:57.000000000', 'message': "Set container MTU equal to dummy interfaces

We explicitly set all dummy interfaces mtu to 9000.
In the meanwhile we're trying to force containers to have mtu 1500
which is not very correct.

Change-Id: I86b57b90540ffe6945f98fafda9ec4742a196e67
"}]
commit_message:
Set container MTU equal to dummy interfaces

We explicitly set all dummy interfaces mtu to 9000.
In the meanwhile we're trying to force containers to have mtu 1500
which is not very correct.

Change-Id: I86b57b90540ffe6945f98fafda9ec4742a196e67

subject: Clean up 20.10 release notes

[{'account_id': 30561, 'date': '2020-10-21 19:37:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 30561, 'date': '2020-10-21 19:50:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 20805, 'date': '2020-10-21 20:59:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Typo needs fixing (mine)

non-blocking:
It feels like we lose information by not having the supported charm list. Having it in the release notes gives an opportunity for point in time comparisions.
I am also not a fan of losing the "bug" tag. My preference is "LP Bug #<num>". Without it is unclear what the link is to anyone who does is not already familiar with launchpad.'}, {'account_id': 30561, 'date': '2020-10-22 22:50:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 20805, 'date': '2020-10-22 23:25:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Typo still there. But I am fine landing it once that is fixed.'}, {'account_id': 30561, 'date': '2020-10-23 02:48:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 30561, 'date': '2020-10-23 14:03:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 30561, 'date': '2020-10-23 14:06:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 30561, 'date': '2020-10-23 15:02:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 8992, 'date': '2020-10-23 17:51:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1

Alright, will convert to a table.'}, {'account_id': 30561, 'date': '2020-10-23 19:27:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 8992, 'date': '2020-10-23 20:44:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+1

lgtm, would be nice to know more of the dates rather than just < 16.10 but I recognize that is an archaeological exercise'}, {'account_id': 20805, 'date': '2020-10-23 20:49:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Needs confirmation.'}, {'account_id': 20805, 'date': '2020-10-23 21:03:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

I have changed my mind. The 20.10 line should not block this change. We can update as needed.
Landing.'}]

commit_message:
Clean up 20.10 release notes

Add 20.10 entries.

Remove invalid known issue ('Restart Nova services').
There are still a few that may be removed (currently
under investigation).

Remove the list of charms and refer to the Charms page
(improves legibility and reduces duplication). Reorganise
the Charms page:

* Convert stable charm information to a table
* Include each stable charm's initial release
  (based on past release notes).
* Implement labelled links as per the style guide

NOTE: The below charms have been ascribed a dubious
initial release (seems wrong):

* glance-simplestreams-sync (20.05)
* nova-cell-controller (20.05)

Move the 'Removed charms' section lower down.

Reword significantly issue 'Neutron Gateway and network
bridges' for clarity.

Minor rewording and fixes.

Update/correct the list of charms on the Charms page.
The ceph-iscsi charm has gone stable and the Trilio
charms went stable with 20.08.

Add ceph-fs to BlueStore compression list of charms.

Change-Id: Iab9fb41238285f151f3ce3603039bcf158ebec4b

commit_message:
Expose nova config option [workaround]/never_download_image_if_on_rbd

This exposes the nova workaround to disable downloading images from glance to
rbd (vs a cheap COW clone) when nova-compute and glance are not backed by the
same ceph cluster.

Related nova change: I069b6b1d28eaf1eee5c7fb8d0fdef9c0c229a1bf

Change-Id: I8329810d6c047c0d94e7b123e7cdc1263a7856cd

commit_message:
Rehome api tests for propagate_uplink_status

Since [0] was merged propagate_uplink_status value is True,
tempest (and neutron-tempest-plugin) is branchless, so
test_create_port_without_propagate_uplink_status and
test_create_port_with_propagate_uplink_status can be moved to
fullstack tests to keep the coverage.

[0]: https://review.opendev.org/744208

Change-Id: I8dfe76e75aa932e587d91f475317b7bac1f02ed9
Related-Bug: #1890842
(cherry picked from commit d2f8a2bea8eab491b626a66a847883fe8ac871e6)

commit_message:
Add option to choose Kafka client in Docker

- Add docker option to choose confluent-kafka or legacy kafka.
- Set confluent-kafka as default.

Story: 2006436
Task: 41145
(cherry picked from commit ef433f084c985b1d60306ec2f1ecf4808af00f04)

commit_message:
Removes generate_lbaas_port_specs method

The _generate_lbaas_port_specs method on the lbaas handler
is not used anymore, it should be removed along with
the unit tests for it.

Change-Id: I3982fc6c292a2823c4581897569e885a27b9e406
Closes-Bug: #1901161

commit_message:
Fix ovs script permissions, add back kubernetes script,
remove openvswitch group, remove unnecessary variable registration.
WIP. Fixes for ovs-vsctl.sh, add scripts for starting ovsdpdk-db and ovs-vswitchd with option for ODL.

Change-Id: I50cd30aa4f3a027efe2364bbae8f8a7bdf4aacd6
Signed-off-by: John Hinman <john.hinman@intel.com>

commit_message:
compute: Validate a BDMs disk_bus when provided

Previously disk_bus values were never validated and could easily end up
being ignored by the underlying virt driver and hypervisor.

For example, a common mistake made by users is to request a virtio-scsi
disk_bus when using the libvirt virt driver. This however isn't a valid
bus and is ignored, defaulting back to the virtio (virtio-blk) bus.

This change adds a simple validation in the compute API using the
potential disk_bus values provided by the DiskBus field class as used
when validating the hw_*_bus image properties.

Conflicts:
    nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_api.py

NOTE(lyarwood): Conflict as If9c459a9a0aa752c478949e4240286cbdb146494 is
not present in stable/train. test_validate_bdm_disk_bus is also updated
as Ib31ba2cbff0ebb22503172d8801b6e0c3d2aa68a is not present in
stable/train.

Closes-Bug: #1876301
Change-Id: I77b28b9cc8f99b159f628f4655d85ff305a71db8
(cherry picked from commit 5913bd889f9d3dfc8d154415e666c821054c229d)
(cherry picked from commit fb31ae430a2e4f8869e77e31ea0d6a9478f6aa61)

Don't install br-ex on standalone

Prevent install of br-ex bridges on standalone jobs, use a
different nodeset for standalone centos-8 jobs.
Change-Id: I902ea61ab0a0969e2e1c188adce71e68ced7de1f

commit_message:
Cleanup listen option from libvirtd service file

This patch ensures that listen option is removed from service file when
libvirt>=5.6 is used, since the option might be left if the deployment
is updated or upgraded from old version.

Related-Bug: #1898553
Related-Bug: #1880619
Change-Id: Ifb0f5e1d7db31885636f689166ff666b049e9414
(cherry picked from commit 20585762919c49e6dffab58664949b23d2306eae)

commit_message:
Use upper constraints for virtualenv in openstack-base

Since Rally has virtualenv in requirements, and is using contraints - it's
trying to downgrade virtualenv from inside a virtualenv.
Let's try to install proper version of packages in openstack-base.

Closes-Bug: #1900419
Change-Id: I2a1e2b6661fd4b62648756416e6147b604dda686

[{'created': '2020-10-21 05:20:24.000000000', 'message': 'Expose new THT params for cpu model flags

This change adds new THT parameters `NovaLibvirtCPUMode`,
`NovaLibvirtCPUModels` and `NovaLibvirtCPUModelExtraFlags`
which allows to configure `libvirt/cpu_mode`, `libvirt/cpu_model`
and `libvirt/cpu_model_extra_flags` parameters respectively.

NOTE: This backport is slightly different from master patch
because of following reasons:
- Change [1] deprecates `libvirt/cpu_model` in favor
of `libvirt/cpu_models` parameter.
- Change [2] removes redundant `libvirt_` prefix from
parameter names.
 [1] Ib8e9ec2e0bde59e72b0ce3639b64d3e8a6ff9eac
 [2] I44dc4e44411657f0c0d6f35051675b12ce77fdef

Change-Id: I8df21d5d171976cbb8670dc5aef744b5fae657b2

commit_message:
Expose new THT params for cpu model flags

This change adds new THT parameters `NovaLibvirtCPUMode`,
`NovaLibvirtCPUModels` and `NovaLibvirtCPUModelExtraFlags`
which allows to configure `libvirt/cpu_mode`, `libvirt/cpu_model`
and `libvirt/cpu_model_extra_flags` parameters respectively.

NOTE: This backport is slightly different from master patch
because of following reasons:
- Change [1] deprecates `libvirt/cpu_model` in favor
of `libvirt/cpu_models` parameter.
- Change [2] removes redundant `libvirt_` prefix from
parameter names.
 [1] Ib8e9ec2e0bde59e72b0ce3639b64d3e8a6ff9eac
 [2] I44dc4e44411657f0c0d6f35051675b12ce77fdef

Change-Id: I8df21d5d171976cbb8670dc5aef744b5fae657b2
(cherry picked from commit 772b7398a7222e8b286848ba00c06006d6b68785)
(cherry picked from commit b0580c6dc498ba080eba67f78a74413b4867c3f5)

commit_message:
Fix pep8 errors

with the switch to Ubuntu Focal for tox jobs via https://review.opendev.org/#/c/738322/
our 1.1.0 version of hacking pulls in old modules that are not compatible
with python3.8:
https://github.com/openstack/hacking/blob/1.1.0/requirements.txt#L6

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/750890/

Change-Id: Icb4ef9f17ff7d033bb8cc8bed9eb8c87dc27ba22
Closes-Bug: #1895093

commit_message:
Fix normal c8 upgrade job for train

We need to include the podman.yaml for centos8 jobs when defining
docker-ha.yaml because in train docker-ha.yaml was docker based.

Change-Id: I31266810091622218f8ddf2bbc1c1bb4c3596947
Closes-Bug: #1900957

commit_message:
Don't manage bridge mappings in scenario file

The bridge mappings should be managed in the standalone parameters. This
bridge mapping prevents us from being able to change the datacentre
mapping in CI.

Change-Id: I6b5b9db75a11c2347720258a39b03aa28702dbf1
Related-Bug: #1895822
(cherry picked from commit c86fa4fb4ee6f4bf86252ca3e1fde25fa55c3677)

commit_message:
DRAC: Fix RAID create_config clean step

This patch fixes this issue by only allowing
the cleaning step to finish after the job to
create the virtual disk completes.

Conflicts:
	ironic/tests/unit/drivers/modules/drac/test_raid.py

Change-Id: I7879e0534018f9a2ad12155fd886b069604bf3d3
Story: 2007285
Task: 38738
(cherry picked from commit 5e4a617b46c713aba762cc74cc0ea0c64c84a0c3)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-08-24 04:08:33.000000000', 'message': "libvirt:driver:Disallow AIO=native when 'O_DIRECT' is not available

Because of the libvirt issue[1], there is a bug[2] that if we set cache mode
whose write semantic is not O_DIRECT (.i.e unsafe, writeback or writethrough),
there will be a problem with the volume drivers
(.i.e nova.virt.libvirt.volume.LibvirtISCSIVolumeDriver,
nova.virt.libvirt.volume.LibvirtNFSVolumeDriver and so on), which designate
native io explicitly.

That problem will generate a libvirt xml for the instance,
whose content contains

```
...
<disk ... >
  <driver ... cache='unsafe/writeback/writethrough' io='native' />
</disk>
...
```
In turn, it will fail to start the instance or attach the disk.

> When qemu is configured with a block device that has aio=native set, but
> the cache mode doesn't use O_DIRECT (i.e. isn't cache=none/directsync or any
> unnamed mode with explicit cache.direct=on), then the raw-posix block driver
> for local files and block devices will silently fall back to aio=threads.
> The blockdev-add interface rejects such combinations, but qemu can't
> change the existing legacy interfaces that libvirt uses today.

[1]: https://github.com/libvirt/libvirt/commit/058384003db776c580d0e5a3016a6384e8eb7b92
[2]: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1086704

Closes-Bug: #1841363
Change-Id: If9acc054100a6733f3659a15dd9fc2d462e84d64
(cherry picked from commit af2405e1181d70cdf60bcd0e40b3e80f2db2e3a6)

commit_message:
libvirt:driver:Disallow AIO=native when 'O_DIRECT' is not available

Because of the libvirt issue[1], there is a bug[2] that if we set cache mode
whose write semantic is not O_DIRECT (.i.e unsafe, writeback or writethrough),
there will be a problem with the volume drivers
(.i.e nova.virt.libvirt.volume.LibvirtISCSIVolumeDriver,
nova.virt.libvirt.volume.LibvirtNFSVolumeDriver and so on), which designate
native io explicitly.

That problem will generate a libvirt xml for the instance,
whose content contains

```
...
<disk ... >
  <driver ... cache='unsafe/writeback/writethrough' io='native' />
</disk>
...
```
In turn, it will fail to start the instance or attach the disk.

> When qemu is configured with a block device that has aio=native set, but
> the cache mode doesn't use O_DIRECT (i.e. isn't cache=none/directsync or any
> unnamed mode with explicit cache.direct=on), then the raw-posix block driver
> for local files and block devices will silently fall back to aio=threads.
> The blockdev-add interface rejects such combinations, but qemu can't
> change the existing legacy interfaces that libvirt uses today.

[1]: https://github.com/libvirt/libvirt/commit/058384003db776c580d0e5a3016a6384e8eb7b92
[2]: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1086704

Closes-Bug: #1841363
Change-Id: If9acc054100a6733f3659a15dd9fc2d462e84d64
(cherry picked from commit af2405e1181d70cdf60bcd0e40b3e80f2db2e3a6)
(cherry picked from commit 0bd58921a1fcaffcc4fac25f63434c9cab93b061)

commit_message:
Support gateway which is not in subnet CIDR in ha_router

There is case that gateway is not in subnet CIDR.
We can set 2 routes as follows to support this:
ip route add 172.16.0.1/32 dev eth0
ip route add default via 172.16.0.1 dev eth0

Closes-bug: #1861674
Change-Id: I69356e926b15de7f1f99540e7cb98671c634e8a9
(cherry picked from commit 554b5c226750ec75e99ebce241df8b7a700ff016)

(3 comments)

Hey Anuradha,

A lot has changed since the initial patch was abandoned. As such, you'll need to rework create-node.py quite a bit.

I gave a couple of examples of changes that would need to be reflected in create-node.py, which I found by looking through the git history of the file here [0].

You could theoretically go through the git history for the file up until about 2016 and adjust the script for each commit, but that might not be enough.

I would absolutely suggest that you look through create-node.sh and create-node.py thoroughly. Once you have a good understanding of create-node.sh, you should be able to translate it to python and use the old version of create-node.py as a basis.

Once this is in better shape, some coordination with the community will be needed so that changes in create-node.sh aren't lost in the  switch to create-node.py. One idea is to eventually freeze any changes to create-node.sh closer to this patch merging.

Let me know if you need any more advice or have any questions! Thanks!

[0] https://github.com/openstack/ironic/commits/master/devstack/tools/ironic/scripts/create-node.sh"}]

commit_message:
Rewrite devstack/tools/ironic/scripts/create-node.sh in Python

Adding the changes from the earlier patch
which got abandoned
Link to the earlier patch - https://review.opendev.org/#/c/346832/
Made changes to the file "ironic" of the directory
"/devstack/lib/ironic"
by replacing create-node.sh to create-node.py

Change-Id: I6a5966aeeddd8223492664d8c00c9e2dc2a7cf71
Story: #1596726
Task: #10471

commit_message:
Add docs for the tripleo_nova_image_cache playbook

Provides some examples, tries to explain the interaction with nova, and
mention the caveats when running with DCN.

Change-Id: Ie32599e86afd336fb4fa31707fdcfe23690d035e

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-09 09:40:45.000000000', 'message': "windows: fix terminating processes

The neutron Windows exec call helper doesn't properly handle the
situation in which the process that it's trying to kill was already
terminated, in which case using wmi to fetch the process can raise
an exception.

This change ensures that those WMI exceptions will be properly
handled.

Closes-Bug: 1872663

Change-Id: I00c810fe541ac5e1e9923155fe90eb07a0b4b3dd
(cherry picked from commit 8fd3e884c7953645862663400af181ba233ec28f)
"}]
commit_message:
windows: fix terminating processes

The neutron Windows exec call helper doesn't properly handle the
situation in which the process that it's trying to kill was already
terminated, in which case using wmi to fetch the process can raise
an exception.

This change ensures that those WMI exceptions will be properly
handled.

Closes-Bug: 1872663

Change-Id: I00c810fe541ac5e1e9923155fe90eb07a0b4b3dd
(cherry picked from commit 8fd3e884c7953645862663400af181ba233ec28f)

commit_message:
OpenStackModule: Support defining a minimum version of the SDK

While it's currently possible to set min_ver and max_ver for specific
parameter, there are times when the whole module needs to specify a
minimum version:

- When the object isn't supported at all prior to a version
- When major features are missing from the SDK prior to a version

Change-Id: I94bbff7c54621e8a4786ebc7eb030103255dcb17

A new tripleo_multipathd role is responsible for preparing and
configuring an overcloud node to run multipathd in a container.
- Host prep tasks ensure any existing multipathd service is disabled
  on the host.
- /etc/multipath.conf configuration is controlled via ansible variables
  supplied by tripleo's OS::TripleO::Services::Multipathd service.
- The multipathd container is restarted whenever the configuration
  changes.

commit_message:
Add tripleo_multipathd role

A new tripleo_multipathd role is responsible for preparing and
configuring an overcloud node to run multipathd in a container.
- Host prep tasks ensure any existing multipathd service is disabled
  on the host.
- /etc/multipath.conf configuration is controlled via ansible variables
  supplied by tripleo's OS::TripleO::Services::Multipathd service.
- The multipathd container is restarted whenever the configuration
  changes.

Change-Id: Icf9faff31d83f0ea77d00a59a53d6ad36b06da4f

commit_message:
BaR Ceph authenticacion more ansible way

Instead of execute a command and redirect the output to a file.
This patch gets the output of the command line and writes it
to a file.

Also fixed the molecule-backup_and_restore test

Change-Id: Ie38d8b9fce36ce2f73a2811072e53f405f1367f6
(cherry picked from commit ad2c7b5892695fd8bb99633724bdb31f36d04c70)

commit_message:
Add tripleo-lvmfilter role to restrict visible block devices for LVM2

The lvmfilter role creates an LVM filter looking at which physical
devices are in use by active logical volumes.

Change-Id: I9781007559e074f2b102f6f90c1aed6def1b02be
Related-Bug: 1855704

subject: postgresql: Optimize restart behavior
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 8898, 'name': 'Chris Wedgwood', 'email': 'cw@f00f.org', 'username': 'anticw'}, {'_account_id': 18256, 'name': 'Hemachandra Reddy', 'email': 'hemachandra.reddy@att.com', 'username': 'hr858f'}, {'_account_id': 18511, 'name': 'Brian Wickersham', 'email': 'bkw86@bellsouth.net', 'username': 'bw6938'}, {'_account_id': 21420, 'name': 'Gage Hugo', 'email': 'gagehugo@gmail.com', 'username': 'ghugo'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 24780, 'name': 'Sangeet Gupta', 'email': 'sg774j@att.com', 'username': 'sgupta'}, {'_account_id': 24816, 'name': 'Anthony Bellino', 'email': 'ab2434@att.com', 'username': 'anthony.bellino'}, {'_account_id': 28719, 'name': 'Phil Sphicas', 'email': 'phil.sphicas@att.com', 'username': 'ps3910'}, {'_account_id': 29144, 'name': 'PRATEEK REDDY DODDA', 'email': 'prateek.reddy.dodda@att.com', 'username': 'pd2839'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 28719, 'date': '2020-10-23 07:41:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28719, 'date': '2020-10-23 07:42:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 24780, 'date': '2020-10-23 12:55:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

If we turn off the readiness probe, the pod is going to come into ready state immediately, even though it may still be coming up. When upgrading postgresql in a live site, if the pods get ready before it is actually ready, may lead to some message failure. Is it acceptable?'}, {'account_id': 18511, 'date': '2020-10-23 13:11:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 24816, 'date': '2020-10-23 13:44:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 29144, 'date': '2020-10-23 14:54:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 8898, 'date': '2020-10-23 15:05:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 28719, 'date': '2020-10-23 15:09:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> If we turn off the readiness probe, the pod is going to come into
 > ready state immediately, even though it may still be coming up.
 > When upgrading postgresql in a live site, if the pods get ready
 > before it is actually ready, may lead to some message failure. Is
 > it acceptable?

If you mean errors in the client pods logs, they will already be experiencing failures.

If you mean in the postgresql pod, I've observed that the pod is up, but because of the long initialDelay on the readinessProbe, no new requests will come in.

Generally speaking, with only a single replica, I just don't see the point of the readiness probe, since there is no other pod that the service can redirect the traffic to, so I think disabled is a better default. However, since it is override-able, I don't feel strongly about it. Let me know if you want me to remove that part of the change."}, {'account_id': 21420, 'date': '2020-10-23 15:38:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 18256, 'date': '2020-10-23 16:19:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-23 07:41:35.000000000', 'message': 'postgresql: Optimize restart behavior

* add preStop hook to trigger Fast Shutdown
* disable readiness probe by default

When Kubernetes terminates a pod, the container runtime typically sends
a SIGTERM signal to pid 1 in each container [0]. PostgreSQL interprets
SIGTERM as a request to do a "Smart Shutdown" [1]. This can take minutes
(often exhausting the termination grace period), and during this time,
new connections are not being serviced.

Now that postgresql has a single replica, this behavior is undesirable.
If we kill the pod (e.g. in an upgrade), we probably want it to come
back as soon as possible.

This change adds a preStop hook that sends a SIGINT to postgresql in
order to trigger a "Fast Shutdown". In addition, the readiness probe is
disabled by default, since it adds no value in a single-replica
scenario.

0: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/pods/pod-lifecycle/#pod-termination
1: https://www.postgresql.org/docs/9.6/server-shutdown.html

Change-Id: Ib5f3d2a49e55332604c91f9a011e87d78947dbef
'}, {'created': '2020-10-23 07:42:00.000000000', 'message': 'postgresql: Optimize restart behavior

* add preStop hook to trigger Fast Shutdown
* disable readiness probe by default

When Kubernetes terminates a pod, the container runtime typically sends
a SIGTERM signal to pid 1 in each container [0]. PostgreSQL interprets
SIGTERM as a request to do a "Smart Shutdown" [1]. This can take minutes
(often exhausting the termination grace period), and during this time,
new connections are not being serviced.

Now that postgresql has a single replica, this behavior is undesirable.
If we kill the pod (e.g. in an upgrade), we probably want it to come
back as soon as possible.

This change adds a preStop hook that sends a SIGINT to postgresql in
order to trigger a "Fast Shutdown". In addition, the readiness probe is
disabled by default, since it adds no value in a single-replica
scenario.

0: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/pods/pod-lifecycle/#pod-termination
1: https://www.postgresql.org/docs/9.6/server-shutdown.html

Change-Id: Ib5f3d2a49e55332604c91f9a011e87d78947dbef
'}]
commit_message:
postgresql: Optimize restart behavior

* add preStop hook to trigger Fast Shutdown
* disable readiness probe by default

When Kubernetes terminates a pod, the container runtime typically sends
a SIGTERM signal to pid 1 in each container [0]. PostgreSQL interprets
SIGTERM as a request to do a "Smart Shutdown" [1]. This can take minutes
(often exhausting the termination grace period), and during this time,
new connections are not being serviced.

Now that postgresql has a single replica, this behavior is undesirable.
If we kill the pod (e.g. in an upgrade), we probably want it to come
back as soon as possible.

This change adds a preStop hook that sends a SIGINT to postgresql in
order to trigger a "Fast Shutdown". In addition, the readiness probe is
disabled by default, since it adds no value in a single-replica
scenario.

0: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/pods/pod-lifecycle/#pod-termination
1: https://www.postgresql.org/docs/9.6/server-shutdown.html

Change-Id: Ib5f3d2a49e55332604c91f9a011e87d78947dbef

[{'created': '2020-10-23 07:03:02.000000000', 'message': 'postgresql: Allow probe tweaking

Uses the standard helm-toolkit macros for liveness and readiness probes,
allowing them to be enabled or disabled, and params to be overridden.

The existing hard-coded settings are preserved as the chart defaults.

commit_message:
postgresql: Allow probe tweaking

Uses the standard helm-toolkit macros for liveness and readiness probes,
allowing them to be enabled or disabled, and params to be overridden.

The existing hard-coded settings are preserved as the chart defaults.

Change-Id: Idd063e6b8721126c88fa22c459f93812151d7b64

This is an automatically generated patch to ensure unit testing
is in place for all the of the tested runtimes for wallaby.

See also the PTI in governance [1].

[1]: https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html

[{'created': '2020-09-14 11:37:34.000000000', 'message': "Add deployment of keystone_auth_default_policy

In case `keystone-auth-enabled` is true in k8s template, magnum requires
keystone_auth_default_policy file to be present.
At this point we suggest creating corresponding roles by deployers
manually, since it's not enabled by default or used widely.

Change-Id: I77bfd3026e3168d7504ef3dc5214cfe706c525dd
"}]
commit_message:
Add deployment of keystone_auth_default_policy

In case `keystone-auth-enabled` is true in k8s template, magnum requires
keystone_auth_default_policy file to be present.
At this point we suggest creating corresponding roles by deployers
manually, since it's not enabled by default or used widely.

Change-Id: I77bfd3026e3168d7504ef3dc5214cfe706c525dd

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-06 10:37:49.000000000', 'message': 'Add agent/explicitly_egress_direct support

This configuration parameter for the ML2/OVS agent was added in
I14fefe289a19b718b247bf0740ca9bc47f8903f4 and backported up to
stable/queens, preventing flooding on integration bridge in some cases.

It needs to be enabled on specific node types, so add option to
configure it.

Related-Bug: #1732067
Change-Id: Iff50d2d086c687ef9ec1ba878e24c06dfc8a7d99
(cherry picked from commit d0bc82d8427c43dac07a8118d2fe35ba5a9d9dce)
'}]
commit_message:
Add agent/explicitly_egress_direct support

This configuration parameter for the ML2/OVS agent was added in
I14fefe289a19b718b247bf0740ca9bc47f8903f4 and backported up to
stable/queens, preventing flooding on integration bridge in some cases.

It needs to be enabled on specific node types, so add option to
configure it.

Related-Bug: #1732067
Change-Id: Iff50d2d086c687ef9ec1ba878e24c06dfc8a7d99
(cherry picked from commit d0bc82d8427c43dac07a8118d2fe35ba5a9d9dce)

commit_message:
Switch to Victoria stable branches

This includes switching to releases of independently released projects.

Projects missing stable branches:

* networking-ansible
* vmware-nsx
* vmware-nsxlib

Includes the following other change squashed to pass CI:

  elasticsearch-curator: install boto before curator

  We need to install older boto versions to get image built.

  Change https://review.opendev.org/759233

Change-Id: I6983b01daa6e577e3238f2823e6e7693d0a73c0a
Co-Authored-By: Marcin Juszkiewicz <marcin.juszkiewicz@linaro.org>

commit_message:
Remove the unused coding style modules

Python modules related to coding style checks (listed in blacklist.txt in
openstack/requirements repo) are dropped from lower-constraints.txt
they are not needed during installation.

Change-Id: Ibc511139dca54a68b85b6d6731f491534fc1a909

commit_message:
Use centos element for dib on focal

Using centos element to build centos8 based image with dib.
The centos-minimal element can't be used on ubuntu focal at the
moment because of missing components (e.g. yum-utils) used by
diskimage-builder to bootstrap the image.

Change-Id: I074abf442280eaee5616b95401fa84bb6fff99ea

[{'created': '2020-10-23 10:20:29.000000000', 'message': 'Add option to choose Kafka client in Docker

- Add docker option to choose confluent-kafka or legacy kafka.
- Set confluent-kafka as default.

commit_message:
Add option to choose Kafka client in Docker

- Add docker option to choose confluent-kafka or legacy kafka.
- Set confluent-kafka as default.

Change-Id: I5464f999ace16d9093e90e7ce7204406131bdf15
Story: 2006436
Task: 41145

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-09-21 06:07:20.000000000', 'message': 'Update devstack plugin

There is no reason to create internal and admin endpoints in DevStack,
most other services have stopped doing so a long time ago.

Also use the global SERVICE_PROTOCOL variable as default for
OCTAVIA_PROTOCOL instead of "http", this will make us automatically
use the secure API access when the tls-proxy service is enabled.

Fix the instructions for using the devstack plugin, too.

Change-Id: I0154b83cb64952844a28895721694d3e2ff82be2
(cherry picked from commit dac24cd7ec9d9d6d6a89a9ab3e099e93854807ff)
'}]
commit_message:
Update devstack plugin

There is no reason to create internal and admin endpoints in DevStack,
most other services have stopped doing so a long time ago.

Also use the global SERVICE_PROTOCOL variable as default for
OCTAVIA_PROTOCOL instead of "http", this will make us automatically
use the secure API access when the tls-proxy service is enabled.

Fix the instructions for using the devstack plugin, too.

Change-Id: I0154b83cb64952844a28895721694d3e2ff82be2
(cherry picked from commit dac24cd7ec9d9d6d6a89a9ab3e099e93854807ff)

commit_message:
Use 'barbican_endpoint_type'config option to get endpoint from catalog

_get_barbican_endpoint now uses barbican_endpoint_type config option to
retrieve a correct endpoint from catalog.

This config option is set to 'public' by default and it's a default
value for ServiceCatalog.endpoint_data_for method. It means that the
default behaviour will be the same as before this patch.

Change-Id: Idf4061fe3e35e3c47a993a56b23c0257c92e5cc3

commit_message:
Make it clearer how to join the meeting

When a meeting URL is provided, use the tooltip to explain that you
can click to join the meeting, rather than confusingly mention that
no one is checked in.

Change-Id: Id0dacd065ce28ed817fd142105cb728392d0efe4

commit_message:
Add releasenotes and py38 jobs

The patch adds config file for release notes generation,
updates README and adds a zuul job template for wallaby cycle
which also includes tox-py38 job.

commit_message:
[train] Switch to content provider jobs/templates

This change switches templates and jobs to the content provider
dependency relation so the jobs share the produced artifacts.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/758214

subject: Check if parents properties exist \Closes-Bug: 1830775
messages:
[{'account_id': 30516, 'date': '2019-05-28 18:12:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2019-05-28 18:12:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 18955, 'date': '2019-06-20 05:37:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Thanks for the fix.

commit_message:
"round" may bump 1 second to 2 if sleep takes more than 1.49 sec

Use less than 2 as a way to account for test on slower systems.
This is a follow up to: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/691883/

Trivial-Fix

Change-Id: Ia313b9c4028f0242cb0da8764b9921c5c30c465a
Fixes-Bug: #1891517

commit_message:
"round" may bump 1 second to 2 if sleep takes more than 1.49 sec

Use less than 2 as a way to account for test on slower systems.
This is a follow up to: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/691883/

Trivial-Fix

Change-Id: Ia313b9c4028f0242cb0da8764b9921c5c30c465a
Fixes-Bug: #1891517

commit_message:
ovn: Add neutron-cleanup

The service cleans up orphaned tap devices on node boot. This is good
for cases were node was fenced or hard rebooted. There is similar patch
for OVS deployments [1].

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/81265737187f32eef2b654a901ed74818873eb88

Closes-bug: #1899799

Change-Id: Idec9e5ca0a8d3de7414938c7f280c06bcbd906c1
Signed-off-by: Jakub Libosvar <libosvar@redhat.com>

subject: Exclude non failing gathering facts action in simplified result
messages:
[{'account_id': 11491, 'date': '2020-10-21 05:59:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 16515, 'date': '2020-10-21 09:53:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2020-10-22 05:35:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Don't we need to do the same for the "failed" part?'}, {'account_id': 11491, 'date': '2020-10-22 15:39:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Don't we need to do the same for the "failed" part?

In the simple_results (which is injected into validation_output dict), we want all the failed tasks and all the warning tasks coming from our custom warn modules. The issue here is that the gathering_facts action has a warnings key in its task results which is set to [] when this action went well. And we don't want to get a long long list of ansible facts in the simple output.

If the gathering_facts fails, it will be caught in the FAILED test.'}, {'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2020-10-23 06:56:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-21 05:59:04.000000000', 'message': 'Exclude non failing gathering facts action in simplified result

The warnings key while gathering facts is set to an empty list if this
action pass successfully. This patch excludes successful gathering facts
action and grab action logs when some real warnings are present.

Change-Id: I23a81c57774bb6259d071b0c3da3a309fc33986c
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud (Strider) <gchamoul@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Exclude non failing gathering facts action in simplified result

The warnings key while gathering facts is set to an empty list if this
action pass successfully. This patch excludes successful gathering facts
action and grab action logs when some real warnings are present.

Change-Id: I23a81c57774bb6259d071b0c3da3a309fc33986c
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud (Strider) <gchamoul@redhat.com>

subject: fix mixed up molecule tests
messages:
[{'account_id': 9914, 'date': '2020-10-21 20:24:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2020-10-22 05:33:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

sounds good - though molecule's still not running. @Gael, any idea?"}, {'account_id': 11491, 'date': '2020-10-22 07:41:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> sounds good - though molecule's still not running. @Gael, any idea?

Yes this is due to [1]. Sorry about that, my mistake!

We don't run the molecule tests in the CI because they are not included in zuul.d/molecule.yaml queue. The switch_vlans shouldn't be in there because no real tests but the tls_everywhere should be in. Ade, please add the jobs in zuul.d/molecule.yaml which where there before [1].

Again sorry for that mix up!

[1] - I02f68b78fdf73a60443d8ea5d2dcb46e5ad67e25"}, {'account_id': 9914, 'date': '2020-10-22 14:09:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 11491, 'date': '2020-10-22 14:10:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2020-10-23 06:54:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1'}]

Change-Id: I627321bd714bda2c81acf337cea7a7263be6b3ac
'}, {'created': '2020-10-22 14:09:43.000000000', 'message': 'fix mixed up molecule tests

In backporting the molecule tests, the tls-everywhere molecule
tests somehow got mixed up with the switch_vlans molecule test.
This error was masked by the fact that the molecule tests

Change-Id: I627321bd714bda2c81acf337cea7a7263be6b3ac
'}]
commit_message:
fix mixed up molecule tests

In backporting the molecule tests, the tls-everywhere molecule
tests somehow got mixed up with the switch_vlans molecule test.
This error was masked by the fact that the molecule tests
were not running at all at the time.

This patch sets the content correctly, and re-adds tls-everywhere
to the zuul queues.

Change-Id: I627321bd714bda2c81acf337cea7a7263be6b3ac

messages:
[{'account_id': 24072, 'date': '2020-10-22 09:42:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-10-22 13:38:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-10-22 15:08:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Review-Priority+2'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-10-22 15:11:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

It's not a particularly pretty fix. It's odd given that we're not using upper constraints, so this should be essentially what anyone installing ES curator would do.

It would be good to have some more information - what is the underlying cause? is this a temporary fix we will be able to revert?"}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-10-23 07:16:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-10-23 07:18:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

added a FIXME to remember about it; it's likely irrelevant what boto version we have here but it is definitely wrong to have to do it like this; seemingly boto dropped support for the older pythons? or what?"}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-10-23 07:18:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

... let's merge to unblock the sad gate"}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-10-23 07:21:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

cheering for https://review.opendev.org/759354 though'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-10-23 07:50:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-10-23 09:06:08.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

squashed into https://review.opendev.org/755339 to pass CI'}]

commit_message:
Add tripleo-lvmfilter role to restrict visible block devices for LVM2

The lvmfilter role creates an LVM filter looking at which physical
devices are in use by active logical volumes.

Change-Id: I9781007559e074f2b102f6f90c1aed6def1b02be
Related-Bug: 1855704
(cherry picked from commit 696814e296cd80cbde134659b61b7e30424d1bc3)
(cherry picked from commit 8ec292137cd21516a9527bab16437b6ed149bd6e)

commit_message:
Fix the centos8 default path error in the quickstart.rst document

The openstack Ussuri and Victoria versions no longer support the
Centos7 and pyrhon2 environment packages. Correct the missing
problems in the latest document

Change-Id: I55fd1bf451d2bdae696ab32d1faffaba72701229
(cherry picked from commit abed85e7fd0a0a9494d75704b55f2b5d40b2a96f)

(4 comments)'}, {'account_id': 21907, 'date': '2020-07-14 03:27:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

Liu, can you tell me what is wrong with the fix proposed earlier by uchenily? https://review.opendev.org/#/c/738397/

Having switch go thru normal source learning behavior seems better (and less prone to bugs, will scale better) than adding explicit output flows for every MAC.

If the original issue (egress flooding) does not affect VLAN networks, isn't that the better approach?"}, {'account_id': 29071, 'date': '2020-07-14 03:41:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

> Liu, can you tell me what is wrong with the fix proposed earlier by
 > uchenily? https://review.opendev.org/#/c/738397/
 > 
 > Having switch go thru normal source learning behavior seems better
 > (and less prone to bugs, will scale better) than adding explicit
 > output flows for every MAC.
 > 
 > If the original issue (egress flooding) does not affect VLAN
 > networks, isn't that the better approach?

+1 and I am thinking why vxlan couldn't use the same data path as vlan in the first place. imo only flow matching dst=dvr_mac should be explicitly filter out and use direct flow...."}, {'account_id': 9531, 'date': '2020-07-14 09:16:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

> Liu, can you tell me what is wrong with the fix proposed earlier by
 > uchenily? https://review.opendev.org/#/c/738397/
 > 
 > Having switch go thru normal source learning behavior seems better
 > (and less prone to bugs, will scale better) than adding explicit
 > output flows for every MAC.
 > 
 > If the original issue (egress flooding) does not affect VLAN
 > networks, isn't that the better approach?

Good questions, from my personal experiences, the "NORMAL" should be used as little as possible. The NORMAL flow is acting as traditional physical switch: learn and forward, or flood. This will cause some problems like MAC table refreshing and ageing, unkown mac flooding. And based on the ovs implementation, there are also some potential problem like fast flow refreshing, fast flow missing and slow flow query. Everytime the MAC is not learned, it flood. So I'm afraid to say it is scale better. We noticed some behavior in physical bridges which are not changed at all. The "NORMAL" will be hit offen, while the vswitchd process is in heavy CPU load. Do you see similar behavior in your cloud?
Secondly, the explicit direct was orginally based on a basic conception: Neutron knows everything. So each pipeline can be explicitly handled by neutron. This has another good point is we could know the status of pipeline for each packets. Neutron can say: "I know the right way! This packet comes from one port, and it should go to another port."
Finally, we should make the behavior consistent with the status of enabling openflow firewall.'}, {'account_id': 29071, 'date': '2020-07-16 15:17:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

> > Liu, can you tell me what is wrong with the fix proposed earlier

 > traditional physical switch: learn and forward, or flood. This will

 > mac flooding. And based on the ovs implementation, there are also

 > hit offen, while the vswitchd process is in heavy CPU load. Do you

 > Secondly, the explicit direct was orginally based on a basic
 > conception: Neutron knows everything. So each pipeline can be
 > explicitly handled by neutron. This has another good point is we
 > could know the status of pipeline for each packets. Neutron can
 > say: "I know the right way! This packet comes from one port, and it
 > should go to another port."
 > Finally, we should make the behavior consistent with the status of
 > enabling openflow firewall.

thank you for reply.. I am think of worried about a "hybrid" situation, for example some vms are managed by openstack and there are also vms which are out of openstack's control, in this situation I am going to experience flooding all the time because its mac address is not going to be learned.

personally I have experienced high cpu usage only when there is endless flooding.. other than that I do think normal flow scales better...'}, {'account_id': 21907, 'date': '2020-07-16 23:42:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

> > Liu, can you tell me what is wrong with the fix proposed earlier
 > by
 > > uchenily? https://review.opendev.org/#/c/738397/
 > >
 > > Having switch go thru normal source learning behavior seems
 > better
 > > (and less prone to bugs, will scale better) than adding explicit
 > > output flows for every MAC.
 > >
 > > If the original issue (egress flooding) does not affect VLAN
 > > networks, isn't that the better approach?
 > 
 > Good questions, from my personal experiences, the "NORMAL" should
 > be used as little as possible. The NORMAL flow is acting as
 > traditional physical switch: learn and forward, or flood. This will
 > cause some problems like MAC table refreshing and ageing, unkown
 > mac flooding. And based on the ovs implementation, there are also
 > some potential problem like fast flow refreshing, fast flow missing
 > and slow flow query. Everytime the MAC is not learned, it flood. So
 > I'm afraid to say it is scale better. We noticed some behavior in
 > physical bridges which are not changed at all. The "NORMAL" will be
 > hit offen, while the vswitchd process is in heavy CPU load. Do you
 > see similar behavior in your cloud?
 > Secondly, the explicit direct was orginally based on a basic
 > conception: Neutron knows everything. So each pipeline can be
 > explicitly handled by neutron. This has another good point is we
 > could know the status of pipeline for each packets. Neutron can
 > say: "I know the right way! This packet comes from one port, and it
 > should go to another port."
 > Finally, we should make the behavior consistent with the status of
 > enabling openflow firewall.

My main concern is that we've seen issues with OVS agent not scaling well when there are many ports/flows to add. This mostly happens for l2pop - certain unicast or flooding entries are missed because hosts take long to re-sync, race conditions due to agent restart window, RPC timeouts, etc... Restarting a dense host's OVS agent can take quite a bit of time for it to repopulate all flows and security groups.

So, just adding hundreds of more flows for OVS agent to manage makes me nervous'}, {'account_id': 21907, 'date': '2020-07-16 23:49:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

also, Norman brings up a good point. Are we always going to get egress flooding for provider networks when we're talking with an external endpoint? Not just a remote VM, but the gateway for provider networks is also an external MAC. So now would ALL external traffic on a provider network be flooded? This would be very bad because at least from what i've seen, most provider network traffic is external (to another provider network in the Openstack cloud, routing handled by physical router) or to public Internet"}, {'account_id': 9531, 'date': '2020-07-17 04:00:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

OK, I will not expand the upper comments.

Thank you guys for the your valueble experiences and suggestions. There are many influencing factors, and the final use cases are also various.
My personal thought is to make the pipeline more clearer, make it explicitly. Implicit forwarding sometimes is not a good way. But seems now we have some conflicts.
From past the neutron team discussions (sorry, I could not find the real link), the ovs-agent is recommented to use openflow firewall for user security group functionalities.

And I'm not going to block any good ideas for these issues, but at least give a option for the potential fix. If you guys have any new works, don't hesitate, please submit it directly.

@Arjun Baindur, @norman shen, you guys are really good to the neutron community, I like such discussion."}, {'account_id': 9531, 'date': '2020-07-17 04:26:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

@norman, hi, after this patch the flooding is also existing? We are trying to kill the flooding, so please share some test cases you met.'}, {'account_id': 9531, 'date': '2020-07-17 04:28:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

> got it. another thing, about this https://review.opendev.org/#/c/731446/
 > PS, are you guys working on the same issue? I see 731446 is trying
 > to make sure no egress flows are left over after live migration or
 > deletion, is that part covered in this PS as well?

Since I've refactored some functions in this patch, so basically yes, this will handle the flow deletion after port removal."}, {'account_id': 9531, 'date': '2020-07-17 04:35:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

> also, Norman brings up a good point. Are we always going to get
 > egress flooding for provider networks when we're talking with an
 > external endpoint? Not just a remote VM, but the gateway for
 > provider networks is also an external MAC. So now would ALL
 > external traffic on a provider network be flooded? This would be
 > very bad because at least from what i've seen, most provider
 > network traffic is external (to another provider network in the
 > Openstack cloud, routing handled by physical router) or to public
 > Internet

@Arjun Baindur, no matter the external mac is, the packets must be sent from a neutron port. So it knows the segmentation (vxlan/vlan), aka the network type and setmentation id can be used to do the direct flow check condition, so in principle each case can be handled by directing packets to right port/bridge/tunnel/physical device."}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2020-07-17 09:11:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1

[{'created': '2020-06-30 05:47:43.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Local mac direct flow for non-openflow firewall

Closes-Bug: #1884708
Change-Id: Iecf9cffaf02616342f1727ad7db85545d8adbec2
'}, {'created': '2020-06-30 10:17:55.000000000', 'message': 'Local mac direct flow for non-openflow firewall

When there is no openflow firewall, aka the ovs agent security group
is disabled or Noop/HybridIptable, this patch will introduce a different
ingress pipeline for bridge ports:
(1) table=0,  in_port=patch_bridge,dl_vlan=physical_vlan action=mod_vlan:local_vlan,goto:60
(2) table=60, in_port=patch_bridge                       action=goto:61
(3) table=61, dl_dst=local_port_mac,dl_vlan=local_vlan,  action=strip_vlan,output:<ofport>
(4) table=61, dl_dst=local_port_mac                      action=output:<ofport>

Closes-Bug: #1884708
Change-Id: Iecf9cffaf02616342f1727ad7db85545d8adbec2
'}, {'created': '2020-07-01 02:53:18.000000000', 'message': 'Local mac direct flow for non-openflow firewall

When there is no openflow firewall, aka the ovs agent security group
is disabled or Noop/HybridIptable, this patch will introduce a different
ingress pipeline for bridge ports:
(1) table=0,  in_port=patch_bridge,dl_vlan=physical_vlan action=mod_vlan:local_vlan,goto:60
(2) table=60, in_port=patch_bridge                       action=goto:61
(3) table=61, dl_dst=local_port_mac,dl_vlan=local_vlan,  action=strip_vlan,output:<ofport>
(4) table=61, dl_dst=local_port_mac                      action=output:<ofport>

Closes-Bug: #1884708
Change-Id: Iecf9cffaf02616342f1727ad7db85545d8adbec2

commit_message:
Local mac direct flow for non-openflow firewall

When there is no openflow firewall, aka the ovs agent security group
is disabled or Noop/HybridIptable, this patch will introduce a different
ingress pipeline for bridge ports which will avoid ingress flood:
(1) table=0,  in_port=patch_bridge,dl_vlan=physical_vlan action=mod_vlan:local_vlan,goto:60 (original)
(2) table=60, in_port=patch_bridge                       action=goto:61                     (new)
(3) table=61, dl_dst=local_port_mac,dl_vlan=local_vlan,  action=strip_vlan,output:<ofport>  (changes)

And changes the local ports pipeline:
(1) table=0,  in_port=local_ofport                       action=goto:25                  (original)
(2) table=25, in_port=local_ofport,dl_src=local_port_mac action=goto:60                  (original)
(3) table=60, in_port=local_ofport,dl_src=local_port_mac action=local_vlan->reg6,goto:61 (changes)
(4) table=61, dl_dst=local_port_mac,reg6=local_vlan,     action=output:<ofport>          (changes)

Closes-Bug: #1884708
Closes-Bug: #1881070
Related-Bug: #1732067
Related-Bug: #1866445
Related-Bug: #1883321

Change-Id: Iecf9cffaf02616342f1727ad7db85545d8adbec2

Fix the centos8 default path error in the quickstart.rst document

The openstack Ussuri and Victoria versions no longer support the
Centos7 and pyrhon2 environment packages. Correct the missing
problems in the latest document

commit_message:
Make DVR router support FLAT network for ovs-agent

Currently codes only support assocate tunnel network and vlan network
to DVR router. This patch add codes that make the flat network assocate
to DVR router and make it work fine.

The patch also remove two unused constant entries: 'FLAT_VLAN_ID' and
'LOCAL_VLAN_ID'

Change-Id: I7d792ce288d96548298f169748565266a130bd86
Closes-Bug: #1876092
(cherry picked from commit cd721a7dcb9073eca2671ffdc9dc7ed9819163ed)

[{'created': '2020-10-15 04:34:24.000000000', 'message': 'Enable smfs software steering when switchdev is enabled

Before this point, when switchdev is enabled, the software
steering mode is not taken into consideration. This patch
tries to enable the smfs software steering mode when the
switchdev mode is enabled, and if it fails, a warning message
would be printed indicating the failur of the proccess, and
the software steering mode will not change from its current value.

Change-Id: I2cee0a5509db7a1c13c9baa056d9d75d16acb0ed
(cherry picked from commit c9b8691f05b35e00a9fec9f013ed0db4942a36f4)
'}]
commit_message:
Enable smfs software steering when switchdev is enabled

Before this point, when switchdev is enabled, the software
steering mode is not taken into consideration. This patch
tries to enable the smfs software steering mode when the
switchdev mode is enabled, and if it fails, a warning message
would be printed indicating the failur of the proccess, and
the software steering mode will not change from its current value.

Change-Id: I2cee0a5509db7a1c13c9baa056d9d75d16acb0ed
(cherry picked from commit c9b8691f05b35e00a9fec9f013ed0db4942a36f4)

commit_message:
Add changes for collectd libpod stats plugin

Because the libpod stats plugin is written in golang rather than C,
it is not included in the collectd rpm and therefor cannot be
configured by puppet-collectd and are made here instead. A simple
variable for enabling will suffice for now since the plugin does
not currently have any configuration options.

Change-Id: I575b6504e24f9d690e1b88b2a6bec296438ce747
Signed-off-by: pleimer <pfbleimer@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 572740bcca245abc834b015e28e2d45838b7668f)

commit_message:
Rename containers prepare parameters tag for ffu.

The ffu's containers prepare step was still using the old's upgrades
tag. This is an issue, as in infrared we skip steps by using skip_tags,
so as this task is wrongly tagged it ends up running when it shouldn't.

Change-Id: I5c57efc07d62bc1692626deb4a4808e21032f522
(cherry picked from commit fd02f2869d0b3fa116ef2bcb823125055927946b)
(cherry picked from commit e5637313319f6d7bdf591efaeec68633eab94fb5)

commit_message:
Make NovaComputeOptVolumes and NovaComputeOptEnvVars role aware

Since multiple types of computes can be deployed, we should allow the
customization of these containers to be role specific.

Change-Id: Ie91633c2bcc8011cc62b46452ea5b444cf12029f

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-02 11:28:06.000000000', 'message': 'Make NeutronOvsdbIdl singleton

"NeutronOvsdbIdl" should be a singleton class; only one instance
should be shared everywhere is called. Currently the connection
and the "OvsIdlMonitor" instances are global; those instances are
used to declare the "NeutronOvsdbIdl" instance.

As commented in the related bug, this singleton will ensure that
the OvsIdl indexes are created just once.

Change-Id: I639cf673a983b7b1be810495d8a8c2d89919a9b6
Related-Bug: #1881424
(cherry picked from commit 178227c8b6636433fcdab4dfd342468335b76aa6)

commit_message:
Make NeutronOvsdbIdl singleton

"NeutronOvsdbIdl" should be a singleton class; only one instance
should be shared everywhere is called. Currently the connection
and the "OvsIdlMonitor" instances are global; those instances are
used to declare the "NeutronOvsdbIdl" instance.

As commented in the related bug, this singleton will ensure that
the OvsIdl indexes are created just once.

Related-Bug: #1881424

Conflicts:
    neutron/common/utils.py

Change-Id: I639cf673a983b7b1be810495d8a8c2d89919a9b6
(cherry picked from commit 178227c8b6636433fcdab4dfd342468335b76aa6)

[{'created': '2020-10-07 09:51:27.000000000', 'message': 'Filter out port with invalid ofport in OVS firewall

Since [1], "get_vif_port_by_id" is also returning ports with an

without a valid ofport. "get_ovs_port" should filter out those ports.

'}]
commit_message:
Filter out port with invalid ofport in OVS firewall

Since [1], "get_vif_port_by_id" is also returning ports with an
invalid ofport. OVS firewall cannot set an OpenFlow rule for a port
without a valid ofport. "get_ovs_port" should filter out those ports.

Related-Bug: #1815989
Related-Bug: #1734320

[1]https://review.opendev.org/#/c/640258/

Change-Id: Id12486b3127ab4ac8ad9ef2b3641da1b79a25a50
(cherry picked from commit c8a819aff4db62e58192af0a272a7f1ce7923146)

commit_message:
Add tripleo-lvmfilter role to restrict visible block devices for LVM2

The lvmfilter role creates an LVM filter looking at which physical
devices are in use by active logical volumes.

Change-Id: I9781007559e074f2b102f6f90c1aed6def1b02be
Related-Bug: 1855704
(cherry picked from commit 696814e296cd80cbde134659b61b7e30424d1bc3)

Using software RAID with whole disk images requires specifying

commit_message:
Allow passing rootfs_uuid for the standalone case

Using software RAID with whole disk images requires specifying
a root partition UUID, but it is only possible through Glance.
This change adds an explicit field for that.

Change-Id: I55e3727aab3960ef472ec2db1f23c25db405e801

We used to deal with docker-images.yaml file in FFWD1 but
now it only causes problems when we blindly reintroduce it.
This works for queens to train but fails on rocky to train
as the file was no longer used.

Change-Id: I8bc93fa88c53965f44e01393e7bd790924dc57f5

commit_message:
FFWD2: cleanup converge

We used to deal with docker-images.yaml file in FFWD1 but
now it only causes problems when we blindly reintroduce it.
This works for queens to train but fails on rocky to train
as the file was no longer used.

Change-Id: I8bc93fa88c53965f44e01393e7bd790924dc57f5
(cherry picked from commit b8668f4e085561f1f7f6da6f8eb889829ca95cd3)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-09-22 23:21:52.000000000', 'message': 'CI: Remove the build check for pre-build ramdisks only

In the devstack plugin, we identify RAX hosts and change the settings
slightly to help ensure CI job passage. This is because the machines are
fully emulated as opposed to paravirtualized which causes a performance
impact with our test VMs that we create. Since we can hit issues
while scheduling on RAX in general, it only makes sense to also
swap the job out for centos based IPA jobs that some how happen on
to a RAX node. Since the CI jobs have largely been "de-typed" name
wise, this should be fine.

Change-Id: I63fc5de05c3975433c12ddd9ba21ebb676de2e6c
(cherry picked from commit 4e8f664ea2d01fe13f55ed7cf3a424cd3c17d289)
'}]
commit_message:
CI: Remove the build check for pre-build ramdisks only

In the devstack plugin, we identify RAX hosts and change the settings
slightly to help ensure CI job passage. This is because the machines are
fully emulated as opposed to paravirtualized which causes a performance
impact with our test VMs that we create. Since we can hit issues
while scheduling on RAX in general, it only makes sense to also
swap the job out for centos based IPA jobs that some how happen on
to a RAX node. Since the CI jobs have largely been "de-typed" name
wise, this should be fine.

Change-Id: I63fc5de05c3975433c12ddd9ba21ebb676de2e6c
(cherry picked from commit 4e8f664ea2d01fe13f55ed7cf3a424cd3c17d289)

commit_message:
Remove ceph-pg from openstack tripleo validator run groups

By design this validation will never suceed when run by openstack
tripleo validator run and thus it should be removed from the groups
that would cause it to be run this way.

Change-Id: I4ad2c6efe18a2cc63c6fa5189d420d7a2be1f753
Closes-Bug: #1900713

messages: [{'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2020-10-21 13:01:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2020-10-22 14:26:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-21 13:01:49.000000000', 'message': "Don't use POLL_SERVER_CFN transport for DeployedServer

For config-download we create a set of dummy DeployedServer
resources that has default software_config_transport property
(POLL_SERVER_CFN) which unnecessarily creates ec2 credentials
for these resources. We've dropped heat_cfn service from
undercloud, so change these to use POLL_SERVER_HEAT instead.

Change-Id: Ia86d117299e92e121a69e059b8a8460ef986cdca
(cherry picked from commit 03aa8b10f686134673250c3bdde5901f693d0bd9)
"}]
commit_message:
Don't use POLL_SERVER_CFN transport for DeployedServer

For config-download we create a set of dummy DeployedServer
resources that has default software_config_transport property
(POLL_SERVER_CFN) which unnecessarily creates ec2 credentials
for these resources. We've dropped heat_cfn service from
undercloud, so change these to use POLL_SERVER_HEAT instead.

Change-Id: Ia86d117299e92e121a69e059b8a8460ef986cdca
(cherry picked from commit 03aa8b10f686134673250c3bdde5901f693d0bd9)

for these resources. We've dropped heat_cfn service from
undercloud, so change these to use POLL_SERVER_HEAT instead.

Change-Id: Ia86d117299e92e121a69e059b8a8460ef986cdca
(cherry picked from commit 03aa8b10f686134673250c3bdde5901f693d0bd9)
"}]
commit_message:
Don't use POLL_SERVER_CFN transport for DeployedServer

For config-download we create a set of dummy DeployedServer
resources that has default software_config_transport property
(POLL_SERVER_CFN) which unnecessarily creates ec2 credentials
for these resources. We've dropped heat_cfn service from
undercloud, so change these to use POLL_SERVER_HEAT instead.

Change-Id: Ia86d117299e92e121a69e059b8a8460ef986cdca
(cherry picked from commit 03aa8b10f686134673250c3bdde5901f693d0bd9)

commit_message:
Add check for nic config with ansible migration

As we've moved to a new way of generating nic configs
with only ansible, this would ensure that we check
if there is any custom heat nic config mapping and
only allow if user sets the 'NetworkConfigWithAnsible'
parameter as false.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/758333
Change-Id: Ief2e6bb41687233d226ab5cb186fc6dbae191ce2

commit_message:

[0]. This change updates THT to use the right name for the CA value.

lower-constraints.
And disable dstat to prevent failures due to dstat bug in focal.

commit_message:
Ensure sysstat package is installed

The change-id, I71355b8501047d4b956f66a5025e70058d7ce0bc, introduced
sysstat package into the overcloud image. However, it won't affect to
the existing deploymennt. This commit ensures that sysstat package is
installed in the overcloud nodes.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/747077/
Change-Id: Ib37b62bf21b502cb69d4fd77aa23b9525a6d5a7b
(cherry picked from commit ec30b7d9b175ebbbe5614e3f777bf61427d92eb3)

commit_message:
[WIP] Fix the designate dns_name confilct for extra port

when the user try to add an extra port to already existing server
or create a server with multiple ports, designate will raise a
conflict exception in dns_name since it will be the same for the
two ports.

This also can solve the problem if the dns_name already exist
it will create another unique dns_name from the dns_name and
ip hash rather than failing to create a record

Change-Id: Ifbe3b4c9f990fa799c9452aaf36058b594fd13a1
Closes-Bug: #1879009

subject: Add a new type HostDomain.

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-08-18 15:37:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-08-18 15:40:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-08-18 15:42:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 27954, 'date': '2020-09-21 15:22:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-09-21 15:24:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 27954, 'date': '2020-09-22 10:24:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2020-09-22 18:59:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

This isn't quite what I had in mind. It still changes the definition of the HostAddress type to allow illegal hostnames. If anyone was relying on that to prevent configuration of invalid hostnames in their service they could now be broken.

What I was thinking was something like a HostDomain opt type that consumers can explicitly choose to use if they want to allow values that would be illegal hostnames.

Given the current implementation, I think you could pretty trivially add that by inheriting from HostAddress and overriding self.hostname to be a Domain."}, {'account_id': 31245, 'date': '2020-10-06 12:28:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2020-10-12 16:23:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

I like the minimal changes here, but it's still changing the definition of the existing opt, which is what I'm trying to avoid. Some more thoughts inline."}, {'account_id': 31245, 'date': '2020-10-13 09:49:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-10-13 09:51:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-10-13 09:53:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

The release note should be updated too'}, {'account_id': 31245, 'date': '2020-10-13 09:56:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 31245, 'date': '2020-10-13 10:00:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 31245, 'date': '2020-10-13 10:01:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2020-10-15 16:49:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

Thanks, this works for me functionally. I just want to have the removed test put back, then I'm +2 on this. The negative tests would be nice too, but I won't block it over those."}, {'account_id': 31245, 'date': '2020-10-22 10:24:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 31245, 'date': '2020-10-22 10:24:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2020-10-22 16:03:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Code-Review+2

Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-10-22 16:41:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Well done, thanks Daniel!'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-08-18 13:41:00.000000000', 'message': 'Allow HostAddressOpt to accept undercore - RFC1033

openstack services are failing to start when a hostname with underscord
_ is provided.

Example:

```
overcloud-novacompute_edge1-0.internalapi.localdomain
overcloud-novacompute_edge1-0.internalapi
```

Nova use `HostAddressOpt` to define `live_migration_inbound_addr`,
and if a hostname with underscore is present in the config file
then the service fail to start.

Example:

```
/etc/nova/nova.conf
live_migration_inbound_addr =
overcloud-novacompute_edge1-0.internalapi.localdomain
```

Underscore are allowed by RFC1033 [1][2][3]. Indeed, while a hostname may not
contain other characters, such as the underscore character (_), other
DNS names may contain the underscore.[1][2].
Systems such as DomainKeys and service records use the underscore.

These changes allow us to use underscore in hostnames.

[1] https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc1912.txt
[2] https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc1033.txt
[3] http://domainkeys.sourceforge.net/underscore.html

Change-Id: I0a0670207f96a987996d329e5efa9a5eb2ce000c
Closes-Bug: #1892044
'}, {'created': '2020-08-18 15:37:52.000000000', 'message': "Allow HostAddressOpt to accept undercore - RFC1033

openstack services are failing to start when a hostname with underscord
_ is provided.

Example:

```
overcloud-novacompute_edge1-0.internalapi.localdomain
overcloud-novacompute_edge1-0.internalapi
```

Nova use `HostAddressOpt` to define `live_migration_inbound_addr`,
and if a hostname with underscore is present in the config file
then the service fail to start.

Example:

```
/etc/nova/nova.conf
live_migration_inbound_addr =
overcloud-novacompute_edge1-0.internalapi.localdomain
```

As described in the documentation of the `HostAdress` type,
this class is designed to:
> represents both valid IP addresses and valid host domain names
> including fully qualified domain names.

FQDN is a domain name that specifies its exact
location in the tree hierarchy of the Domain Name System (DNS).

Underscore are allowed by RFC1033 [1][2][3]. Indeed, while a hostname may not
contain other characters, such as the underscore character (_), other
DNS names may contain the underscore.[1][2].
Systems such as DomainKeys and service records use the underscore.

These changes allow us to use underscore with the `HostAddressOpt` by
introducing a new type (`Domain`) that represent the DNS's format.

[1] https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc1912.txt
[2] https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc1033.txt
[3] http://domainkeys.sourceforge.net/underscore.html

Change-Id: I0a0670207f96a987996d329e5efa9a5eb2ce000c
Closes-Bug: #1892044

[1] https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc1912.txt
[2] https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc1033.txt
[3] http://domainkeys.sourceforge.net/underscore.html

"}, {'created': '2020-10-06 12:28:26.000000000', 'message': "Allow HostAddressOpt to accept undercore - RFC1033

openstack services are failing to start when a hostname with underscore
_ is provided.

Example:

```
overcloud-novacompute_edge1-0.internalapi.localdomain
overcloud-novacompute_edge1-0.internalapi
```

Nova use `HostAddressOpt` to define `live_migration_inbound_addr`,
and if a hostname with underscore is present in the config file
then the service fail to start.

Example:

```
/etc/nova/nova.conf
live_migration_inbound_addr =
overcloud-novacompute_edge1-0.internalapi.localdomain
```

As described in the documentation of the `HostAdress` type,
this class is designed to:
> represents both valid IP addresses and valid host domain names
> including fully qualified domain names.

FQDN is a domain name that specifies its exact
location in the tree hierarchy of the Domain Name System (DNS).

Underscore are allowed by RFC1033 [1][2][3]. Indeed, while a hostname may not
contain other characters, such as the underscore character (_), other
DNS names may contain the underscore.[1][2].
Systems such as DomainKeys and service records use the underscore.

These changes allow us to use underscore with the `HostAddressOpt` by
introducing a new type (`Domain`) that represent the DNS's format.

[1] https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc1912.txt
[2] https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc1033.txt
[3] http://domainkeys.sourceforge.net/underscore.html

commit_message:
Add a new type HostDomain.

HostDomain is like HostAddress with the support of
_ character - RFC1033

openstack services are failing to start when a hostname with underscore
_ is provided.

Example:

```
overcloud-novacompute_edge1-0.internalapi.localdomain
overcloud-novacompute_edge1-0.internalapi
```

Nova use `HostAddressOpt` to define `live_migration_inbound_addr`,
and if a hostname with underscore is present in the config file
then the service fail to start.

Example:

```
/etc/nova/nova.conf
live_migration_inbound_addr =
overcloud-novacompute_edge1-0.internalapi.localdomain
```

FQDN is a domain name that specifies its exact
location in the tree hierarchy of the Domain Name System (DNS).

Underscore are allowed by RFC1033 [1][2][3]. Indeed, while a hostname may not
contain other characters, such as the underscore character (_), other
DNS names may contain the underscore.[1][2].
Systems such as DomainKeys and service records use the underscore.

These changes allow us to use underscore with the `HostDomain`.

[1] https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc1912.txt
[2] https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc1033.txt
[3] http://domainkeys.sourceforge.net/underscore.html

Co-authored-by: Daniel Bengtsson <dbengt@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I0a0670207f96a987996d329e5efa9a5eb2ce000c
Closes-Bug: #1892044

commit_message:
Switch to quay.io for ceph_namespace for all releases

Since we are moving from dockerhub to quay.io to avoid rate
limit issues.

In order to do that, we are changing the ceph_namespace to
quay.io for all releases. As all the images used in TripleO
CI for different releases are already there.

Change-Id: I73a2a17fbb26026c207c5e8f949e4a9913e3d934
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>

The functional tests break [1] wth versions of virtualenv 20 or greater
so pin the version on stable branches so that tests keep working.

Change-Id: Ie9c677933364afc9b3ea1821ee9f0d70589c5683
'}]
commit_message:
Pin virtualenv<20 for python2 functional tests

The functional tests break [1] wth versions of virtualenv 20 or greater
so pin the version on stable branches so that tests keep working.

[1] http://paste.openstack.org/show/798877/

Change-Id: Ie9c677933364afc9b3ea1821ee9f0d70589c5683
