messages: [{'account_id': 26343, 'date': '2020-10-21 20:58:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2020-10-22 10:51:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 11090, 'date': '2020-10-22 17:24:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked\n\nThis patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/train as commit f9c57260c674e254e14e31ced6f283142a1abf1a'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-21 20:58:05.000000000', 'message': "Rename containers prepare parameters tag for ffu.

The ffu's containers prepare step was still using the old's upgrades
tag. This is an issue, as in infrared we skip steps by using skip_tags,
so as this task is wrongly tagged it ends up running when it shouldn't.

Change-Id: I5c57efc07d62bc1692626deb4a4808e21032f522
(cherry picked from commit fd02f2869d0b3fa116ef2bcb823125055927946b)
"}]
commit_message:
Rename containers prepare parameters tag for ffu.

The ffu's containers prepare step was still using the old's upgrades
tag. This is an issue, as in infrared we skip steps by using skip_tags,
so as this task is wrongly tagged it ends up running when it shouldn't.

Change-Id: I5c57efc07d62bc1692626deb4a4808e21032f522
(cherry picked from commit fd02f2869d0b3fa116ef2bcb823125055927946b)

commit_message:
[DNM] For networking-sfc, add MPLS correlation

This patch adds the MPLS correlation to networking-sfc Port Pairs help
description, and updates tests just to make sure that Port Pairs
can be created or updated with the MPLS correlation.

Change-Id: I57e8c03485ec96d33438c813858e5965b32e8ed8
Related-Bug: #1587486

commit_message:
Fix molecule requirements

There's a pytest-molecule bug around ansible version in the latest
version. Pin it to <1.30 for now.

Additionally move the requirements out of tox.ini into it's own file to
match other repositories.

Change-Id: I516b38fa0766a9aaa15c00495cae4a781b769c4c
Partial-Bug: #1900033

commit_message:
Improve logging of vm's console output when test fails

In some tests we were still missing logging of the server's
console output and local network configuration.
This patch adds such logging where it was missing.

Also I saw in the gate that e.g. in test_remote_connectivity
paramiko's SSH exception can be raised instead of tempest SSHTimeout
so this patch adds handle for such case also.

Change-Id: Ided06bf6f1bb8d2fbe0084dc73e731b832eb465c

commit_message:
Remove references to setuptools

With the advent of importlib, entry points are no long a setuptools-only
thing. Update the docs to reflect that.

Change-Id: I099f397ddb4d71879597cfe67ef2a1eff4a8d1af
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Don't manage bridge mappings in scenario file

The bridge mappings should be managed in the standalone parameters. This
bridge mapping prevents us from being able to change the datacentre
mapping in CI.

Change-Id: I6b5b9db75a11c2347720258a39b03aa28702dbf1
Related-Bug: #1895822

commit_message:
Don't create LOG if not logging

This cleans up a few cases where a LOG instance was being created, but
no logging was actually happening in the file.

Change-Id: I0d5dbf5e8e781c2674dde1904535e03bb2385abc
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Add BRODCAST_MAC constant with "FF:FF:FF:FF:FF:FF" value

This address is used in many places in Neutron and some stadium projects
so it will be good to have it defined in the neutron-lib and reuse in
all those places later.

Change-Id: I599507ca9892d51e5dfeefeecc343e2d2d52796c

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-10 18:41:12.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: Increase incremental and max sleep time during device detach

Bug #1894804 outlines how DEVICE_DELETED events were often missing from
QEMU on Focal based OpenStack CI hosts as originally seen in bug
 #1882521. This has eventually been tracked down to some undefined QEMU
behaviour when a new device_del QMP command is received while another is
still being processed, causing the original attempt to be aborted.

We hit this race in slower OpenStack CI envs as n-cpu rather crudely
retries attempts to detach devices using the RetryDecorator from
oslo.service. The default incremental sleep time currently being tight
enough to ensure QEMU is still processing the first device_del request
on these slower CI hosts when n-cpu asks libvirt to retry the detach,
sending another device_del to QEMU hitting the above behaviour.

Additionally we have also seen the following check being hit when
testing with QEMU >= v5.0.0. This check now rejects overlapping
device_del requests in QEMU rather than aborting the original:

https://github.com/qemu/qemu/commit/cce8944cc9efab47d4bf29cfffb3470371c3541b

This change aims to avoid this situation entirely by raising the default
incremental sleep time between detach requests from 2 seconds to 10,
leaving enough time for the first attempt to complete. The overall
maximum sleep time is also increased from 30 to 60 seconds.

Future work will aim to entirely remove this retry logic with a libvirt
event driven approach, polling for the the
VIR_DOMAIN_EVENT_ID_DEVICE_REMOVED and
VIR_DOMAIN_EVENT_ID_DEVICE_REMOVAL_FAILED events before retrying.

Finally, the cleanup of unused arguments in detach_device_with_retry is
left for a follow up change in order to keep this initial change small
enough to quickly backport.

Closes-Bug: #1882521
Related-Bug: #1894804
Change-Id: Ib9ed7069cef5b73033351f7a78a3fb566753970d
(cherry picked from commit dd1e6d4b0cee465fd89744e306fcd25228b3f7cc)
'}]
commit_message:
libvirt: Increase incremental and max sleep time during device detach

Bug #1894804 outlines how DEVICE_DELETED events were often missing from
QEMU on Focal based OpenStack CI hosts as originally seen in bug
 #1882521. This has eventually been tracked down to some undefined QEMU
behaviour when a new device_del QMP command is received while another is
still being processed, causing the original attempt to be aborted.

We hit this race in slower OpenStack CI envs as n-cpu rather crudely
retries attempts to detach devices using the RetryDecorator from
oslo.service. The default incremental sleep time currently being tight
enough to ensure QEMU is still processing the first device_del request
on these slower CI hosts when n-cpu asks libvirt to retry the detach,
sending another device_del to QEMU hitting the above behaviour.

Additionally we have also seen the following check being hit when
testing with QEMU >= v5.0.0. This check now rejects overlapping
device_del requests in QEMU rather than aborting the original:

https://github.com/qemu/qemu/commit/cce8944cc9efab47d4bf29cfffb3470371c3541b

This change aims to avoid this situation entirely by raising the default
incremental sleep time between detach requests from 2 seconds to 10,
leaving enough time for the first attempt to complete. The overall
maximum sleep time is also increased from 30 to 60 seconds.

Future work will aim to entirely remove this retry logic with a libvirt
event driven approach, polling for the the
VIR_DOMAIN_EVENT_ID_DEVICE_REMOVED and
VIR_DOMAIN_EVENT_ID_DEVICE_REMOVAL_FAILED events before retrying.

Finally, the cleanup of unused arguments in detach_device_with_retry is
left for a follow up change in order to keep this initial change small
enough to quickly backport.

Closes-Bug: #1882521
Related-Bug: #1894804
Change-Id: Ib9ed7069cef5b73033351f7a78a3fb566753970d
(cherry picked from commit dd1e6d4b0cee465fd89744e306fcd25228b3f7cc)

commit_message:
Add Tempest gate job for stable/victoria

Now we have stable/victoria branch ready for devstack
and so does for all service projects.

This commit adds the Tempest testing for stable/victoria
by adding new jobs running on stable/victoria version of
openstack.

commit_message:
Add back undercloud skiplist for older release

https://review.opendev.org/#/c/758030 removed the undercloud
skiplist during victoria branching and it broke the c7 based
stein, rocky and queens undercloud jobs.

Adding it back fixes the issue.

Change-Id: I230b8939fabe57a5ef8137ae249b28a76ee169bc
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>

subject: Fix fernet cron path on Ubuntu/Debian
messages: [{'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-10-22 08:36:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-10-22 11:48:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-22 08:36:51.000000000', 'message': 'Fix fernet cron path on Ubuntu/Debian

The correct path according to Ubuntu cron manpage [1] is
/var/spool/cron/crontabs/$USER

[1]: http://manpages.ubuntu.com/manpages/trusty/man8/cron.8.html

Closes-Bug: #1898765
Change-Id: Id5fc354e3e32cae2468cd2557a2967859e3b4e16
(cherry picked from commit 07d42bff01c811daf6e19b4c4984950243613157)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix fernet cron path on Ubuntu/Debian

The correct path according to Ubuntu cron manpage [1] is
/var/spool/cron/crontabs/$USER

[1]: http://manpages.ubuntu.com/manpages/trusty/man8/cron.8.html

Closes-Bug: #1898765
Change-Id: Id5fc354e3e32cae2468cd2557a2967859e3b4e16
(cherry picked from commit 07d42bff01c811daf6e19b4c4984950243613157)

commit_message:
js: Don't attempt to set bug, PDF links without configuration

Generating both the bug link and PDF download link requires some
configuration in 'conf.py': specifically, the 'openstack_bug_project'
and 'openstack_pdf_link' config options must be set. If these are not
present, the template doesn't include the relevant tags, which means
attempts to look these up via 'getElementById' will return 'null',
causing ugly tracebacks like so in the console.

  Uncaught ReferenceError: bugProject is not defined
    <anonymous> http://localhost:8000/search.html?q=usage:395

Simply surround these blocks with the same conditionals as the template,
avoiding the issue entirely.

Change-Id: I08ef0fc6c7ebd2c0e7ba89bc42cc92176fec8ab8
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1896607

subject: Store empty string for release
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-09-22 11:08:57.000000000', 'message': 'Store empty string for release

If we're unable to extract the project version from the package, we
leave things unversioned. Unfortunately, that means setting the
'version' and 'release' config options to 'None'. These should be
strings and setting them to 'None' results in the following errors:

  WARNING: The config value `release' has type `NoneType', defaults to `str'.
  ...

  Exception occurred:
    File ".../sphinx/builders/html/__init__.py", line 475, in prepare_writing
      'release': return_codes_re.sub('', self.config.release),
  TypeError: expected string or bytes-like object

Simply set an empty string instead.

Change-Id: I6df4a90b04f3ed89c69fb7669027feda6c5ffe79
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1896609
'}]
commit_message:
Store empty string for release

If we're unable to extract the project version from the package, we
leave things unversioned. Unfortunately, that means setting the
'version' and 'release' config options to 'None'. These should be
strings and setting them to 'None' results in the following errors:

  WARNING: The config value `release' has type `NoneType', defaults to `str'.
  ...

  Exception occurred:
    File ".../sphinx/builders/html/__init__.py", line 475, in prepare_writing
      'release': return_codes_re.sub('', self.config.release),
  TypeError: expected string or bytes-like object

Simply set an empty string instead.

Change-Id: I6df4a90b04f3ed89c69fb7669027feda6c5ffe79
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1896609

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-09-22 11:08:57.000000000', 'message': "js: Set 'LINK_SUFFIX'

Sphinx 3.0.0 changed the behavior of JavaScript-based search utility,
changing the configuration option used to determine the suffix for
search results from 'html_file_suffix' to 'html_link_suffix' [1]. We
were manually overriding 'DOCUMENTATION_OPTIONS' and were not setting
the 'LINK_SUFFIX' attribute, which maps to this config option, meaning
our resulting URLs looked like 'fooundefined', where 'foo' is the name
of the file.

Add 'LINK_SUFFIX', resolving this issue.

[1] https://github.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/commit/a717ffec78

Change-Id: I06488225cf0431e601f16e0f1047a6088a11d5bd
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
Closes-bug: #1880331
"}]
commit_message:
js: Set 'LINK_SUFFIX'

Sphinx 3.0.0 changed the behavior of JavaScript-based search utility,
changing the configuration option used to determine the suffix for
search results from 'html_file_suffix' to 'html_link_suffix' [1]. We
were manually overriding 'DOCUMENTATION_OPTIONS' and were not setting
the 'LINK_SUFFIX' attribute, which maps to this config option, meaning
our resulting URLs looked like 'fooundefined', where 'foo' is the name
of the file.

Add 'LINK_SUFFIX', resolving this issue.

[1] https://github.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/commit/a717ffec78

Change-Id: I06488225cf0431e601f16e0f1047a6088a11d5bd
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
Closes-bug: #1880331

commit_message:
Set NeutronEnableDVR to False for OVN-HA

deployment/neutron/neutron-plugin-ml2-ovn.yaml sets DVR by default.
We need to explicitly mark the environment variable NeutronEnableDVR
to False to disable DVR.

Change-Id: Ie6b2af65a59d88ec7ea582da18c516e95ea7ed9e

commit_message:
Fix typos, extreamio and xtreamio to xtremio

dellemc_extremio_iscsi is a wrong name.
It has to be dellemc_xtremio_iscsi.
And xtreamio should be xtremio.

commit_message:
Fix typos, extreamio and xtreamio to xtremio

dellemc_extremio_iscsi is a wrong name.
It has to be dellemc_xtremio_iscsi.
And xtreamio should be xtremio.

Change-Id: I7ba7b3ca151bf101742dc84ad80204cda42e2dbb

commit_message:
Change permissions on /run/octavia to octavia

The driver agent and the API processes need permission to manage the
contents of /run/octavia.

Change-Id: I103d88a1acdc9843fc419746779bdaa132ca569f
Related-Bug: #1887801

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-07-23 14:30:45.000000000', 'message': 'Memcached collectd plugin uses host URI instead of IP address.

This fixes a bug in the Service Telemetry Framework where all collectd
plugins report the host by URI except for the memcached plugin, causing
the appearance of more nodes than exist in the dashboards.

Change-Id: Ie653deb69d9d72f811c3238d64437f6542cd2a4d
'}]
commit_message:
Memcached collectd plugin uses host URI instead of IP address.

This fixes a bug in the Service Telemetry Framework where all collectd
plugins report the host by URI except for the memcached plugin, causing
the appearance of more nodes than exist in the dashboards.

Change-Id: Ie653deb69d9d72f811c3238d64437f6542cd2a4d

subject: Fix fernet cron path on Ubuntu/Debian
messages: [{'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-10-22 08:37:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2020-10-22 09:36:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-10-22 11:48:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-22 08:37:00.000000000', 'message': 'Fix fernet cron path on Ubuntu/Debian

The correct path according to Ubuntu cron manpage [1] is
/var/spool/cron/crontabs/$USER

[1]: http://manpages.ubuntu.com/manpages/trusty/man8/cron.8.html

Closes-Bug: #1898765
Change-Id: Id5fc354e3e32cae2468cd2557a2967859e3b4e16
(cherry picked from commit 07d42bff01c811daf6e19b4c4984950243613157)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix fernet cron path on Ubuntu/Debian

The correct path according to Ubuntu cron manpage [1] is
/var/spool/cron/crontabs/$USER

[1]: http://manpages.ubuntu.com/manpages/trusty/man8/cron.8.html

Closes-Bug: #1898765
Change-Id: Id5fc354e3e32cae2468cd2557a2967859e3b4e16
(cherry picked from commit 07d42bff01c811daf6e19b4c4984950243613157)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-01 20:50:22.000000000', 'message': "Add ability to have RabbitMQ do its own SSL

This is necessary if you'd like to secure RabbitMQ traffic. The HAProxy
solution has a number of disadvantages, and RabbitMQ/erlang are very
good at providing native TLS/SSL.

The options for CA certs and keys and such can be handled in
inventory/globals/passwords. By default this will do nothing and users
who want TLS/SSL for their RabbitMQ can do so via HAProxy.

Change-Id: I08b4325ec1e0cb6bc405ef54616b9f0200066509

commit_message:
Add ability to have RabbitMQ do its own SSL

This is necessary if you'd like to secure RabbitMQ traffic. The HAProxy
solution has a number of disadvantages, and RabbitMQ/erlang are very
good at providing native TLS/SSL.

The options for CA certs and keys and such can be handled in
inventory/globals/passwords. By default this will do nothing and users
who want TLS/SSL for their RabbitMQ can do so via HAProxy.

Change-Id: I08b4325ec1e0cb6bc405ef54616b9f0200066509

commit_message:
"scope" conversion only just before pyroute2 method call

In "IpAddrCommand.list" method, the "scope" parameter is a string
("link", "site", "global" or "host"). This method will retrieve all
devices with an IP address calling "ip_lib.get_devices_with_ip".

Since [1], "ip_lib.get_devices_with_ip" makes the conversion of
"scope" string parameter to pyroute2 format (see
"pyroute2.netlink.rtnl.rtscopes"). The list command should skip then
the previous conversion.

Closes-Bug: #1899141

[1]https://review.opendev.org/#/c/747406/

Change-Id: I55a0f4341b328af52ea3bd758a72f633fbe3abcb

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-01 06:45:21.000000000', 'message': 'Fix python2 AttributeError with strptime

Fix a potential python2 error when calling strptime, the first call to
strptime is not thread safe and might trigger an exception.
A workaround was added by calling strptime before creating a thread but
the caller is itself within a thread, so it may fail.

The workaround is now to explicitly import _strptime as described in the
upstream python issue https://bugs.python.org/issue7980

Note: This commit only applies to branches that support python2 (initial
commit in stable/train)

Story 2008211
Task 40997

Change-Id: I0e7119d5a379f8662c4913d7232ef28535a29b32
'}]
commit_message:
Fix python2 AttributeError with strptime

Fix a potential python2 error when calling strptime, the first call to
strptime is not thread safe and might trigger an exception.
A workaround was added by calling strptime before creating a thread but
the caller is itself within a thread, so it may fail.

The workaround is now to explicitly import _strptime as described in the
upstream python issue https://bugs.python.org/issue7980

Note: This commit only applies to branches that support python2 (initial
commit in stable/train)

Story 2008211
Task 40997

Change-Id: I0e7119d5a379f8662c4913d7232ef28535a29b32

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-22 12:24:10.000000000', 'message': "Temporarily stop booting nodes in inap-mtl01

We're seeing a high incidence of job nodes return RESULT_UNREACHABLE
mid-build, enough to cause frequent RETRY_LIMIT results for changes.
Temporarily cease running jobs there until we/they can work out
whatever connectivity or rogue instance issues are causing this.

Change-Id: I4afd92ee64911f0611733ed9c92ec0a4bada54f5
"}]
commit_message:
Temporarily stop booting nodes in inap-mtl01

We're seeing a high incidence of job nodes return RESULT_UNREACHABLE
mid-build, enough to cause frequent RETRY_LIMIT results for changes.
Temporarily cease running jobs there until we/they can work out
whatever connectivity or rogue instance issues are causing this.

Change-Id: I4afd92ee64911f0611733ed9c92ec0a4bada54f5

subject: Add setuptools in upper-constraints.txt file.
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 11904, 'name': 'Sean McGinnis', 'email': 'sean.mcginnis@gmail.com', 'username': 'SeanM'}, {'_account_id': 14288, 'name': 'Matthew Thode', 'display_name': 'prometheanfire', 'email': 'mthode@mthode.org', 'username': 'prometheanfire'}, {'_account_id': 16688, 'name': 'Rodolfo Alonso', 'email': 'ralonsoh@redhat.com', 'username': 'rodolfo-alonso-hernandez'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 26343, 'name': 'Jose Luis Franco', 'email': 'jfrancoa@redhat.com', 'username': 'jfrancoa'}, {'_account_id': 27380, 'name': 'Boyron Sébastien', 'email': 'sboyron@redhat.com', 'username': 'sboyron'}, {'_account_id': 28522, 'name': 'Hervé Beraud', 'email': 'herveberaud.pro@gmail.com', 'username': 'hberaud'}, {'_account_id': 31245, 'name': 'Daniel Bengtsson', 'email': 'dbengt@redhat.com', 'username': 'damani42'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 31245, 'date': '2020-10-14 08:05:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-10-14 08:45:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

The rationale behind these changes LGTM.

However I've some concerns related to pbr:
- pbr rely on setuptools [1] and still support python2.7 [2]
- setuptools 50.3.0 only support python3 [3]

So I wonder if we should also define a version which support python2.7 to avoid issues on with this context. setuptools dropped the support of python 2 with 45.0.0 [4] so we could use the version 44.1.1 [5] for this use case.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/pbr/src/branch/master/setup.py#L16
[2] https://opendev.org/openstack/pbr/src/branch/master/setup.cfg#L25
[3] https://pypi.org/project/setuptools/50.3.0/
[4] https://setuptools.readthedocs.io/en/latest/history.html#v45-0-0
[5] https://pypi.org/project/setuptools/44.1.1/"}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2020-10-14 17:09:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-10-15 07:15:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Waiting a bit for opinions about pbr'}, {'account_id': 27380, 'date': '2020-10-15 07:40:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hi, 
I think Hervé remark is pertinent on which version to fix in the requirements.txt, it could be worth to have more discussion about it before patching all projects.

By the way,  Hervé proposed to tag all these changes with the "setuptools-explicit" topic. It could be great to match it.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-10-15 07:49:27.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from add_setuptools to setuptools-explicit'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-10-15 08:24:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Hi,
 > I think Hervé remark is pertinent on which version to fix in the
 > requirements.txt, it could be worth to have more discussion about
 > it before patching all projects.
 > 
 > By the way,  Hervé proposed to tag all these changes with the
 > "setuptools-explicit" topic. It could be great to match it.

It could be easily fixed by adding something like:

```
setuptools===44.1.1;python_version=='2.7'
setuptools===50.3.0;python_version>='3.5'
```'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2020-10-15 08:47:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 26343, 'date': '2020-10-19 20:30:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-10-21 14:39:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 31245, 'date': '2020-10-22 09:34:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-14 08:05:13.000000000', 'message': "Add setuptools in upper-constraints.txt file.

Like explain here[1] the setuptools is used but not explicitly install
by the project. It's install by pbr at the moment, but explicit is
better than implicit.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-October/017740.html

Change-Id: Ic916867079c2d277fd420f181f949c1cfcbdeb00
"}]
commit_message:
Add setuptools in upper-constraints.txt file.

Like explain here[1] the setuptools is used but not explicitly install
by the project. It's install by pbr at the moment, but explicit is
better than implicit.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-October/017740.html

Change-Id: Ic916867079c2d277fd420f181f949c1cfcbdeb00

subject: db: Compact Kilo database migrations
messages: [{'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-10-22 12:35:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-10-22 12:35:54.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned\n\nDuplicate of https://review.opendev.org/#/c/758396/'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-22 12:35:28.000000000', 'message': "db: Compact Kilo database migrations

Compacts Kilo database migrations into a single migration,
'280_kilo.py'.

Users will now need to update to Kilo before updating to Liberty of
later.

This change is significantly more complicated than previous compactions,
mostly due to the changes to indexes specifically for PostgreSQL and
SQLite.

Specific changes include:

- Drop duplicate index covering 'host' and 'deleted' field of
  'instances' table (265)
- Drop duplicate index covering 'host' field of 'iscsi_targets' table
  (265)
- Add 'tags' table (266)
- Alter 'uuid' column of 'instances' table to be non-nullable (267)
- Add unique constraint to 'uuid' column of 'instances' table (267)
- Add 'host' column to 'compute_nodes' table (268)
- Add unique constraint to 'host' and 'hypervisor_hostname' columns of
  'compute_nodes' table (268)
- Add 'numa_node' column to 'pci_devices' table (269)
- Add 'flavor' column to 'instance_extra' table (270)
- Add a number of missing indexes to multiple tables on SQLite and
  PostgreSQL (271)
- Add a number of missing foreign keys and unique constraints to
  multiple tables on SQLite (273)
- Add index covering 'project_id' and 'deleted' columns of 'instances'
  table (274)
- Drop index covering 'project_id' column of 'instances' table (274)
- Add 'type' column to 'key_pairs' table (275)
- Add 'vcpu_model' column to 'instance_extra' table (276)
- Add index covering 'deleted', 'allocated', and 'updated_at' columns of
  'fixed_ips' table (277)
- Alter 'service_id' column of 'compute_nodes' table to be nullable
  (278)
- Drop foreign key constraint on 'service_id' column of 'compute_nodes'
  table (278)
- Drop unique constraint covering 'host' and 'hypervisor_hostname'
  columns of 'compute_nodes' table in favour of constraint covering
  'host', 'hypervisor_hostname' and 'deleted' columns (279)
- Alter 'name' column of 'key_pairs' table to be non-nullable (280)

Once again, we have a case where we've forgotten to apply a change to
the shadow table. We also have our first instance of table, the 'tags'
table, that does is not soft deletable and therefore does not have a
shadow table. Both are handled and the former can be resolved later.

Also note that we encounter a small bug in sqlalchemy-migrate, whereby
declaration of an index before a foreign key that affects the same
column will result in it attempting to drop the index, even if it was
never created. See comments inline.

Now that we can rely on the 'instances.uuid' column being unique and
non-nullable, we can remove the 'null_instance_uuid_scan' nova-manage
command. This will be done separately.

Change-Id: I0aac6a3cc80cabc6c292374505f4bb1a2f513540
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
db: Compact Kilo database migrations

Compacts Kilo database migrations into a single migration,
'280_kilo.py'.

Users will now need to update to Kilo before updating to Liberty of
later.

This change is significantly more complicated than previous compactions,
mostly due to the changes to indexes specifically for PostgreSQL and
SQLite.

Specific changes include:

- Drop duplicate index covering 'host' and 'deleted' field of
  'instances' table (265)
- Drop duplicate index covering 'host' field of 'iscsi_targets' table
  (265)
- Add 'tags' table (266)
- Alter 'uuid' column of 'instances' table to be non-nullable (267)
- Add unique constraint to 'uuid' column of 'instances' table (267)
- Add 'host' column to 'compute_nodes' table (268)
- Add unique constraint to 'host' and 'hypervisor_hostname' columns of
  'compute_nodes' table (268)
- Add 'numa_node' column to 'pci_devices' table (269)
- Add 'flavor' column to 'instance_extra' table (270)
- Add a number of missing indexes to multiple tables on SQLite and
  PostgreSQL (271)
- Add a number of missing foreign keys and unique constraints to
  multiple tables on SQLite (273)
- Add index covering 'project_id' and 'deleted' columns of 'instances'
  table (274)
- Drop index covering 'project_id' column of 'instances' table (274)
- Add 'type' column to 'key_pairs' table (275)
- Add 'vcpu_model' column to 'instance_extra' table (276)
- Add index covering 'deleted', 'allocated', and 'updated_at' columns of
  'fixed_ips' table (277)
- Alter 'service_id' column of 'compute_nodes' table to be nullable
  (278)
- Drop foreign key constraint on 'service_id' column of 'compute_nodes'
  table (278)
- Drop unique constraint covering 'host' and 'hypervisor_hostname'
  columns of 'compute_nodes' table in favour of constraint covering
  'host', 'hypervisor_hostname' and 'deleted' columns (279)
- Alter 'name' column of 'key_pairs' table to be non-nullable (280)

Once again, we have a case where we've forgotten to apply a change to
the shadow table. We also have our first instance of table, the 'tags'
table, that does is not soft deletable and therefore does not have a
shadow table. Both are handled and the former can be resolved later.

Also note that we encounter a small bug in sqlalchemy-migrate, whereby
declaration of an index before a foreign key that affects the same
column will result in it attempting to drop the index, even if it was
never created. See comments inline.

Now that we can rely on the 'instances.uuid' column being unique and
non-nullable, we can remove the 'null_instance_uuid_scan' nova-manage
command. This will be done separately.

Change-Id: I0aac6a3cc80cabc6c292374505f4bb1a2f513540
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Ignore DELETED amphorae when performing certificate rotation

Deleted amphorae should not be included when housekeeping service is
performing certificate rotation. Otherwise, deleted amphorae will
become ERROR.

Story: #2007635
Task: #39681

Change-Id: Ie2c748ff69c8fd736e9c67d686068a33d803222e
(cherry picked from commit f3eff29ce17e5d27867b6e6f4049ae6d51d2751c)

The correct path according to Ubuntu cron manpage [1] is

Closes-Bug: #1898765

commit_message:
Fix fernet cron path on Ubuntu/Debian

The correct path according to Ubuntu cron manpage [1] is
/var/spool/cron/crontabs/$USER

[1]: http://manpages.ubuntu.com/manpages/trusty/man8/cron.8.html

Closes-Bug: #1898765
Change-Id: Id5fc354e3e32cae2468cd2557a2967859e3b4e16
(cherry picked from commit 07d42bff01c811daf6e19b4c4984950243613157)

commit_message:
add min of 1 to rpc_conn_pool_size

This change add a min value of 1 to
[oslo_messaging_rabbit]/rpc_conn_pool_size
such that there is always at least 1 connection avaiable.

This change add a runtime check to ensure that
[oslo_messaging_rabbit]/rpc_conn_pool_size is greater than
or equal too [oslo_messaging_rabbit]/conn_pool_min_size

Change-Id: I2ad4b9f1d012c9f0586a932ac27d96da1bcc4e4c
Closes-Bug: #1899533
(cherry picked from commit 00d15eaeaba0ded0330cdcec7b19eee3adbfb1e1)
(cherry picked from commit 8f5847dcbe5144272ff7295fce2b50a9f544e5b0)

subject: corrects selflink on kubernetes resources
messages:
[{'account_id': 32493, 'date': '2020-10-21 13:53:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 27032, 'date': '2020-10-21 14:48:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

Thanks for the fix. Here goes a few tweaks needed  and the comments are also valid to the other files.

Just a reminder..kuryrport, kuryrloadbalancer, kuryrnetworkpolicy and kuryrnetwork resources are kuryr resources represented on Kubernetes API and should use the K8S_API_CRD_NAMESPACES constant to construct their respective paths.'}, {'account_id': 27032, 'date': '2020-10-21 14:49:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11600, 'date': '2020-10-22 11:25:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I propose using a totally different approach. Instead of manually deciding how to build link, let's write a getSelfLink() method (e.g. in k8s_client) that will do that from a resource. Each K8s resource representation have several properties:

obj['apiVersion']
obj['kind']
obj['metadata']['name']
obj['metadata']['namespace'] (optional)

Now to build URL from that you just need to do the following:

f'/api/{obj['apiVersion']}/namespaces/{obj['metadata']['namespace']}/{kind}/{obj['metadata']['name']}

or for non-namespaced objects:

f'/api/{obj['apiVersion']}/{kind}/{obj['metadata']['name']}

The only tricky part is `kind` variable - because obj['kind'] will read e.g. 'Pod' and we need to put 'pods' in the URL. In order to do that I propose having some matching table that will translate obj['kind'] into URL-like resource names - as we don't really fetch that many objects it should be fairly easy to do."}, {'account_id': 32493, 'date': '2020-10-22 11:57:49.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-21 13:53:03.000000000', 'message': 'corrects selflink on kubernetes resources

The selflink field on a Kubernetes Resource will stop being
propagated on Kubernetes 1.20.
We need to ensure the selfLink is replaced on Kuryr
with a string URL that represents the object being handled

Change-Id: I46212acfe11ed9222bb826ecdf4b1b0898344939
Closes-Bug: #1897554
'}]
commit_message:
corrects selflink on kubernetes resources

The selflink field on a Kubernetes Resource will stop being
propagated on Kubernetes 1.20.
We need to ensure the selfLink is replaced on Kuryr
with a string URL that represents the object being handled

Change-Id: I46212acfe11ed9222bb826ecdf4b1b0898344939
Closes-Bug: #1897554

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-13 11:43:02.000000000', 'message': 'Fix pool delete race on load balancer cascade delete

In what appears to be a race condition, load balancer cascade delete can
fail while deleting numerous pools. The load balancer can still be
deleted with one or more follow-up cascade delete API calls but this is
suboptimal.

Per local testing, the ValueError exception is harmless so we can just
ignore it and continue the pool delete flow, with no orphan resources
left behind resulting from the exception skip.

Task: 41096
Story: 2008249

Change-Id: I9283d9804feb83a1d5a160da48da6146b19da88c
(cherry picked from commit 332791ee2b3cf29d01d94a9bb53fda4043303fd8)

commit_message:
Fix pool delete race on load balancer cascade delete

In what appears to be a race condition, load balancer cascade delete can
fail while deleting numerous pools. The load balancer can still be
deleted with one or more follow-up cascade delete API calls but this is
suboptimal.

Per local testing, the ValueError exception is harmless so we can just
ignore it and continue the pool delete flow, with no orphan resources
left behind resulting from the exception skip.

Task: 41096
Story: 2008249

Change-Id: I9283d9804feb83a1d5a160da48da6146b19da88c
(cherry picked from commit 332791ee2b3cf29d01d94a9bb53fda4043303fd8)

[{'created': '2020-10-19 18:34:08.000000000', 'message': 'Temporarily set octavia-v2-dsvm-py2-scenario non-voting

A recent change lowered the swap space on nodepool instances to 1 GB
[1]. Octavia scenario jobs were impacted, particularly Python 2 jobs
to the point -py2 job builds constantly fail.

To unlock stable/train and stable/stein gates, we need to temporarily
set octavia-v2-dsvm-py2-scenario non-voting. This change will be
reverted as soon as [2] and [3] merge.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/750941/
[2] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/755777
[3] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/757841/

Change-Id: Ifc53049e7135e2623bcf7bc2287262ba2f70382d
'}]
commit_message:
Temporarily set octavia-v2-dsvm-py2-scenario non-voting

A recent change lowered the swap space on nodepool instances to 1 GB
[1]. Octavia scenario jobs were impacted, particularly Python 2 jobs
to the point -py2 job builds constantly fail.

To unlock stable/train and stable/stein gates, we need to temporarily
set octavia-v2-dsvm-py2-scenario non-voting. This change will be
reverted as soon as [2] and [3] merge.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/750941/
[2] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/755777
[3] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/757841/

Change-Id: Ifc53049e7135e2623bcf7bc2287262ba2f70382d

commit_message:
Handle openssl command outputting warnings

When running openssl v1.1.1 it can output text to
stder eg:

*** WARNING : deprecated key derivation used. Using -iter or -pbkdf2 would be better.

Don't error on this text, note strategy is copied from how nova do it.

Story: #2007758
Task: #39966

Change-Id: I4bc742f81a43da2e11623def4e2d06173b75baed

this change corrects the flag order from 'route -6'
to '-6 route' as the -6 flag is an option when used with
ip is an argument to the the ip command and not the route
subcommand.

-6 is accpeted as an argument to the standalone 'route'
commannd but not 'ip route' subcommand.

"}]
commit_message:
fix ipv6 flag order in worlddump

this change corrects the flag order from 'route -6'
to '-6 route' as the -6 flag is an option when used with
ip is an argument to the the ip command and not the route
subcommand.

-6 is accpeted as an argument to the standalone 'route'
commannd but not 'ip route' subcommand.

Change-Id: Ic2ae472e42b7b455693d0aade48dc5109e1f21ba

commit_message:
FFWD2: cleanup converge

We used to deal with docker-images.yaml file in FFWD1 but
now it only causes problems when we blindly reintroduce it.
This works for queens to train but fails on rocky to train
as the file was no longer used.

Change-Id: I8bc93fa88c53965f44e01393e7bd790924dc57f5

commit_message:
Adds graphical console implementation for ilo drivers

This patch exposes the graphical console implementation
for ``ilo`` hardware type.

story: #1567629
task: #29836

RPC changes for Graphical Console

This patch adds the RPC and API changes for Graphical Console.

Story: #1567629
task: #25753

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-07-13 01:10:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(11 comments)

Greetings Madhuri!

It looks like this breaks the upgradability of the API and Conductors as it presently exists. Part of this is due to positional arguments being inserted, which might be why the existing console unit tests are failing.

That being said, I think we should focus on a noop and fake interface pairs so we can build the basic interface, and then an implementation on top of that substrate. That will also give us time to work out details like... a sushy-tools wrapper or something that triggers libvirt VNC.

We will also need tests, but we'll get there. Much of the basic interface tests should be fairly clear, and for the actual API, RPC, Conductor methods we'll just have to have to have a duplicate test case. 

Hopefully that helps you get started!

-Julia"}, {'account_id': 10206, 'date': '2018-07-13 07:31:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 10206, 'date': '2018-07-13 07:34:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

'}, {'created': '2018-07-05 06:08:22.000000000', 'message': '[DNM][WIP] Implement GraphicalConsole Interface

This patch implements a new interface ``GraphicalConsoleInterface``
which can be used to access graphical console of a node.
Note: The code is not ready yet to be used.

commit_message:
Implement basic interfaces for GraphicalConsole Interface

This patch implements the basic interfaces ``NoGraphicalConsole``
and ``FakeGraphicalConsole`` for the new ``GraphicalConsoleInterface``
which can be used to access graphical console of a node.

Change-Id: Ie54670e064ba1dc852086063c0a328f6c6675723
Story: #1567629
Task: #24533

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 12394, 'date': '2016-06-15 16:22:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(40 comments)'}, {'account_id': 1063, 'date': '2016-06-15 19:29:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I think that this represents a misunderstanding of the current state of the Nova scheduler. Recent changes have added a 'force' parameter (default False) to live migration, so that by default all live migrations are run through the scheduler. If you try to live migrate to a host that is inappropriate, due to either capacity or some other placement rule, it will raise a HostNotFound exception, and the migration will not happen.

So I believe that there is no need for this spec."}, {'account_id': 16495, 'date': '2016-06-16 09:51:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(33 comments)'}, {'account_id': 16495, 'date': '2016-06-17 07:49:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-06-17 08:00:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified+1

(5 comments)'}, {'account_id': 7664, 'date': '2016-06-20 06:37:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

Given Ed's new information on this front, perhaps we just try forcing the migration (but pass the option to run the filters on targeted migration) and if host X fails, we try X + 1, X + 2, ..., until we don't run into a NVH exception.

Yes, this is admittedly a little clunky, but at least it 'works' with the out-of-box Nova code and gives us a baseline off of which we can build.  If we start running into a lot of examples where this is problematic (which I think we may, especially in larger data centers), we can cite those cases in an effort for some cross-project design work with the Nova team to help us with these situations.

Thoughts?"}, {'account_id': 16495, 'date': '2016-06-20 07:52:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(2 comments)

Thanks a lot for your comments. I will push a new patchset.'}, {'account_id': 16495, 'date': '2016-06-20 08:26:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-06-20 08:41:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Verified-1

(4 comments)

honestly, I don't know yet what could be the best way for this. Not sure the Nova scheduler should provide a way to dryrun a select_destination call... I actually wonder if that could be far better to have a discovery API that Watcher could consume so it would figure out a proposal that the nova scheduler would validate..."}, {'account_id': 16495, 'date': '2016-06-29 06:45:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 7664, 'date': '2016-06-30 01:11:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 22453, 'date': '2016-06-30 14:04:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Hi,

Sorry for joining the conversation so lately. 

I really agree that it is important that Watcher could get a complete reflexive model to reason on the current system configuration. 

By analogy, the human body has two main “reasoning” capabilities: reflex and thinking. ECA rules can be seen as a kind of reflex, since they do not really involve any reasoning.
In the case where the system is in a critical context, they can quickly reconfigure the system into an acceptable configuration. 
Goal-based decision techniques perfectly match the definition of “thinking”. Depending on the resource and the time allowed to reasoning, the system can evaluate different configurations and find the one which offers the best trade-of.

Nova must remain the master controlers that validate all the reconfigurations and maybe support some reflex actions.
Congress could be also the place to implement some ECA rules. 

However, we could also imagine that Watcher could be the place to connect any advanced algorithms that plays the role of "thinking". If we want to guarantee that watcher can think "correctly", it is really important that it can get all the informations within its internl representation.'}, {'account_id': 16495, 'date': '2016-06-30 14:57:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

commit_message:
WiP Watcher should enforce the Nova policies

In the current implementation of watcher, we are bypassing the
rules of the nova scheduler.This may result in failure or even worse,
the violation of the nova policies (affinity rules, capacity, ...).
This is clearly not sustainable, watcher strategies have to be conform to
the administrators specifications.

Co-Authored-By: Jean-Emile DARTOIS <jean-emile.dartois@b-com.com>
Co-Authored-By: Susanne Balle <sleipnir012@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I6b7572dfd7b62eb3cad9a2e4c128af3545b00883
blueprint: nova-policies

commit_message:
Ubuntu has libvirt 6.0

The UCA repo has libvirt 6.0 from Ussuri
on Bionic and later.

Closes-Bug: #1898553
Change-Id: I8146f5b073e812f3cac472fc5e27976f17d248b4
(cherry picked from commit a44641df76730484ec82d119c9473251bee7ad72)

commit_message:
Update the references to the OpenStack Foundation to its new name

This patch changes OpenStack Foundation to Open Infrastructure
Foundation following the recent name change. It also updates the reference
to the Foundation individual memebreship account including the screenshot.

The patch also updates the outdated reference to the OpenStack Summit which
is now called Open Infrastructure Summit and is scheduled to happen annually.

Change-Id: Ia7b2246980c57a7c7355829276b53cdcae0cded7
Signed-off-by: Ildiko Vancsa <ildiko.vancsa@gmail.com>

[{'created': '2020-10-21 11:35:43.000000000', 'message': "CNI: Lookup offending interface on NetlinkError

The infamous `NetlinkError: (17, 'File exists')` started to bug us again
due to changes in when cri-o is deleting network namespaces. This patch
is an ultimate brute-force attempt to fix the problem. The idea is that
on NetlinkError kuryr-daemon will iterate over *all* network namespaces
in the system and delete interfaces that have the conflicting VLAN ID.

Closes-Bug: 1892388

commit_message:
CNI: Lookup offending interface on NetlinkError

The infamous `NetlinkError: (17, 'File exists')` started to bug us again
due to changes in when cri-o is deleting network namespaces. This patch
is an ultimate brute-force attempt to fix the problem. The idea is that
on NetlinkError kuryr-daemon will iterate over *all* network namespaces
in the system and delete interfaces that have the conflicting VLAN ID.

Closes-Bug: 1892388

Change-Id: I6672ed0e0db99a91b68cc4d9e74a33d8a9bcf0ca

[{'account_id': 32522, 'date': '2020-10-08 13:27:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2020-10-08 13:27:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Congratulations, you've proposed your first change in OpenDev.

Your submission will now be tested automatically by Zuul, our gatekeeper,
and reviewed by other friendly developers. They will give you feedback and
may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches often take days (and sometimes weeks) to get reviewed, so be
patient. Don't hesitate to ask for help, and answer questions about your
work promptly if you can. The more you get to know reviewers and get to be
known by them, the smoother the review and approval process will become. The
fastest way to accomplish this is by reviewing other proposed changes
yourself: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for participating in OpenDev, we look forward to seeing you
around.

Workflow Guide: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html"}, {'account_id': 19339, 'date': '2020-10-08 16:15:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Greetings! You've hit a rebase conflict where your local copy of the git repo has changed since you submitted this change.

in your local repo, you'll need to do the following:
git checkout master
git pull --ff-only
git review -x 756708
git rebase -i master

At this point, you'll need to resolve the merge conflicts. The files will contain a header/footer indicating what was in master branch and what was in your change and you'll need to do the reconcillation manually. Hopefully, it just works.

Once you've edited the files `git status` shows as not having been staged.

git add <filename>
git rebase --continue
git review

Hope this helps!"}, {'account_id': 32522, 'date': '2020-10-09 09:53:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 15519, 'date': '2020-10-09 10:19:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
Update .rst files

This commit removes `--os-baremetal-api-version` from CLI examples,
updates some `openstack baremetal` commands to be `baremetal` and
removes -uuid from <node-uuid>

Story: 2008194
Task: 40964

Change-Id: I4421e98afdee9ed97506cb7e5d69da966cffd963

commit_message:
Set safe version of hacking

Versions of hacking from 3.1.0 until 4.0.0 NOT included are supposed
to require a safe version of flake8, so besides normale issues related
to minor version upgrades, we can safely use those versions.
Also forcing pycodestyle versions to be compatible with flake8 installed
by hacking.

Change-Id: Ifa2af7404f4cd85cffd29ed725278d04a7c5f8c6

commit_message:
Update Events Exercises

We don't just have Summits anymore, we now have OpenDev
events too, and they aren't always announced as far ahead
as they used to be.

commit_message:
Fix fernet cron path on Ubuntu/Debian

The correct path according to Ubuntu cron manpage [1] is
/var/spool/cron/crontabs/$USER

[1]: http://manpages.ubuntu.com/manpages/trusty/man8/cron.8.html

Closes-Bug: #1898765
Change-Id: Id5fc354e3e32cae2468cd2557a2967859e3b4e16

commit_message:
Remove tempest_private_net_provider_type from featuresets

This configuration should not be used in featureset, because it would
never be overwriten, it should be in the playbooks/tempest.yml in
tripleo-quickstart-extras

Change-Id: I06480c30e0c671c3f97361c8bdc06c5fc28dfb94

commit_message:
Migrate to content provider jobs/templates

This change migrate c8 jobs/templates to content provider
jos so consumer jobs can use resources built by provider
jobs.

Change-Id: Id75e272510239fd051f6948e4c10a53321eae1c5
Signed-off-by: Amol Kahat <amolkahat@gmail.com>

commit_message:
overcloud-compute:  add linuxptp package for timemaster service

To configure tripleo-timemaster service we need linuxptp
in overcloud image.

tripleo-heat-template and tripleo-ansible patches
[0]: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/748431/
[1]: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/748439/

commit_message:
Add sysstat package to collect sar data by default

sar data is an important information for performance issue or
other troubleshooting. The package is recommended to be installed
by default.

Change-Id: I71355b8501047d4b956f66a5025e70058d7ce0bc
(cherry picked from commit d4db347bc2a2304e14f94e76fa58073cd1888d3b)

commit_message:
Add sysstat package to collect sar data by default

sar data is an important information for performance issue or
other troubleshooting. The package is recommended to be installed
by default.

Change-Id: I71355b8501047d4b956f66a5025e70058d7ce0bc
(cherry picked from commit d4db347bc2a2304e14f94e76fa58073cd1888d3b)

commit_message:
Migrate to content provider jobs/templates

This change migrate c8 jobs/templates to content provider
jos so consumer jobs can use resources built by provider
jobs.

Change-Id: I17a40cbf6fb978bec17ab21fb2296ad3db46b6b3
Signed-off-by: Amol Kahat <amolkahat@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Switch to content provider jobs/templates

This change switches templates and jobs to the content provider
dependency relation so the jobs share the produced artifacts.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/756128
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/756131

Change-Id: I9ba0b9b137fa2fa9f2f73d91864c0089013a3289

Replace ansible include with import_playbook

Make use of import_playbook instead of deprecated and misleading
include.

commit_message:
Deprecate validate-tempest skiplist

This remove all content of the tempest_skip_$branch but keep the file
with a warning pointing to openstack/openstack-tempest-skiplist.
The files remain because we are still in the proccess of moving

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/726773/

Change-Id: I7532b691732b119e89271b5a70fe6ec5696eeb6e

commit_message:
Add amqp send queue limit for collectd

send_queue_limit was added recently to puppet-collectd and
will be available in puppet-collectd-12.2

Change-Id: Ida812cdbe5141ff91a7db7c46e422f86fb762f98

commit_message:
Include ovs_driver and sriov_driver classes in base neutron profile

This classes are needed to configure things related to the
sriov or ovs mechanism drivers on neutron server like e.g.
vnic_type_blacklist.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/756527

commit_message:
Replace deprecated openstacklib::db::mysql::password_hash

Since [1] was merged into puppet-openstacklib, the password_hash
parameter has been deprecated. Now hash value is generated in
puppet-openstacklib layer, and a plain password should be passed
via the password parameter instead.

[1] e4b68e9ad62bc55f9d941874bc3af97c01e4bc61

Change-Id: Ia3455e90a40f35a378f8643fd9c8d4d251b44141

commit_message:
Include the nova::quota class for nova quota configuration

The nova::quota class provides interface to set parameters for nova
quota, and including the class helps us set these parameters easily.

Change-Id: I260880986d700a210bf623ad1f4903c6a5e29194

commit_message:
Switch to content provider jobs/templates

This change switches templates and jobs to the content provider
dependency relation so the jobs share the produced artifacts.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/756128

commit_message:
Add changes for collectd libpod stats plugin

Because the libpod stats plugin is written in golang rather than C,
it is not included in the collectd rpm and therefor cannot be
configured by puppet-collectd and are made here instead. A simple
variable for enabling will suffice for now since the plugin does
not currently have any configuration options.

Change-Id: I575b6504e24f9d690e1b88b2a6bec296438ce747
Signed-off-by: pleimer <pfbleimer@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 1ae59bf3558bc8d19f46b535f31150629ccff09a)

commit_message:
Add changes for collectd libpod stats plugin

Because the libpod stats plugin is written in golang rather than C,
it is not included in the collectd rpm and therefor cannot be
configured by puppet-collectd and are made here instead. A simple
variable for enabling will suffice for now since the plugin does
not currently have any configuration options.

Change-Id: I575b6504e24f9d690e1b88b2a6bec296438ce747
Signed-off-by: pleimer <pfbleimer@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Update comment to fix lint error

This patch updats comment in several manifests to fix lint error with
the following messages:
 - No matching class parameter for documentation of <parameter name>
 - Duplicate class parameter documentation for <parameter name>

Change-Id: I927fc43fefe169d4041d980ef834975822d3755d

commit_message:
Add fence_cisco_ucs support in tripleo fencing manifests

Add fence_cisco_ucs support in tripleo fencing manifests since
pacemaker puppet modules supports this easily.  We already tested
this patch and it worked flawlessly.

Change-Id: I0cbefd2b23c890e0f4d97153895fbeedff861ace
(cherry picked from commit 528dc8394f4a92c58cb451116aa58634a26daff8)

commit_message:
Add fence_cisco_ucs support in tripleo fencing manifests

Add fence_cisco_ucs support in tripleo fencing manifests since
pacemaker puppet modules supports this easily.  We already tested
this patch and it worked flawlessly.

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-29 00:02:59.000000000', 'message': 'Allow enabling custom share protocols with manila

Manila service has a sane default for enabled NAS
protocols for the installation. Triple-O only has
special handling for the CephFS backend, so prevent
overriding the option unless using the CephFS backend
or if the user explicitly wants to override the
option.

Change-Id: I7b36e5c45b029f070976e58335d79678752a990c
Closes-Bug: #1831767

commit_message:
Allow overriding share protocols with manila

We need a way to override available protocols
for enabled Shared File Systems service back ends,
or enable custom ones per the deployment.

Change-Id: I7b36e5c45b029f070976e58335d79678752a990c
Closes-Bug: #1831767
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Alan Bishop <abishop@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix typos, extreamio and xtreamio to xtremio

dellemc_extremio_iscsi is a wrong name.
It has to be dellemc_xtremio_iscsi.
And xtreamio should be xtremio.

Conflicts:
 manifests/profile/base/cinder/volume.pp

Change-Id: I7ba7b3ca151bf101742dc84ad80204cda42e2dbb
(cherry picked from commit ef40cb9fce7ff3f74be55bdc93b0f10648a417c1)
(cherry picked from commit 8c8fa833392da90787852bd3382c8ffea0319094)

Improve documentations for NovaLibvirtFileBackedMemory

There is some interplay between this option and other memory-related
options. Document this.

commit_message:
Adds new configuration for panko-expirer

This patch enables limiting count of records panko-expirer is deleting each run.
We need that to avoid expirer failures on huge event databases.

Depends-On: I7ca0ab9e42352645e463c49f8ce58793115543c0
Change-Id: Idc59d4958a3919c6b457fcad083e0d07afe10892

commit_message:
Memcached collectd plugin uses host URI instead of IP address.

This fixes a bug in the Service Telemetry Framework where all collectd
plugins report the host by URI except for the memcached plugin, causing
the appearance of more nodes than exist in the dashboards.

Change-Id: Ie653deb69d9d72f811c3238d64437f6542cd2a4d
(cherry picked from commit 52831ef10c82b2b73f95ffdcaea72fc0273752ac)

subject: Revert "Adapt container health check for built-in podman health checks"
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-09 15:15:13.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Adapt container health check for built-in podman health checks"

This reverts commit 31a1f9c8ed4ad8a212e146cc59e5273048570b32.

In train health checks are still scheduled and executed by systemd.
So there is no need for adaptation to podman managed health checks.

Change-Id: I1e43a1ee5a72afabb0f3ba650c9dd40d0a29d6ac
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Adapt container health check for built-in podman health checks"

This reverts commit 31a1f9c8ed4ad8a212e146cc59e5273048570b32.

In train health checks are still scheduled and executed by systemd.
So there is no need for adaptation to podman managed health checks.

Change-Id: I1e43a1ee5a72afabb0f3ba650c9dd40d0a29d6ac

commit_message:
[train] mysql: adjust CLI args based on container cli

k8s-file log driver only exists for podman, such as log-opt path option.
For docker, we'll use syslogd log driver.

Note: this patch is only done for train and stein, where we still
support Docker.

Change-Id: Ie47e1cd81b25914d28ac63668817ce6237e2e8a9
Closes-Bug: #1898610
(cherry picked from commit f35c3455097a91cf6e07456b339829d82c18ad65)

commit_message:
Support designate profile when redis is not available

Designate can function without redis in testing environments like
tripleo-standalone where multiple producers are not present.

Change-Id: I1f8bb80cb7498cba12aae399321369dc55c33523

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-21 12:17:05.000000000', 'message': "Adjust all the URLs to point to docs.openstack.org

We had a weird mix of non-existing URLs, and pointing to opendev.org
and to launchpad and other places. Lets put everything point the same
way under https://docs.openstack.org/$project, which redirects to the
newest documentation then automatically.

The other option would be to point to the project navigator, but that
doesn't have all othe components on the granularity that we package
here, and the urls are not stable (require a releases/$releasename
within), so that idea was discarded.

Change-Id: I0ccca433a5e5dbc1082c93d4c5f84ed3fcbed2fe
"}]
commit_message:
Adjust all the URLs to point to docs.openstack.org

We had a weird mix of non-existing URLs, and pointing to opendev.org
and to launchpad and other places. Lets put everything point the same
way under https://docs.openstack.org/$project, which redirects to the
newest documentation then automatically.

The other option would be to point to the project navigator, but that
doesn't have all othe components on the granularity that we package
here, and the urls are not stable (require a releases/$releasename
within), so that idea was discarded.

Change-Id: I0ccca433a5e5dbc1082c93d4c5f84ed3fcbed2fe

fixes:
  - |
    Linux kernel 5.8 changed the sysfs interface that is used to
    discover the interfaces used for OVS offloads for certain NIC
    models. This results in network plugging failure, as described
    in `bug #1892132`_. This release fixes the plugging issue by
    properly handling the new sysfs structure.

kernel change.

to their parent PCI device, and so "get_ifname_by_pci_address" fails
to get the correct UpLink Representor.

commit_message:
Fix - os-vif fails to get the correct UpLink Representor

Till kernel 5.7 PF and VF representors are exposed as virtual device.
They are not linked to its parent PCI device like how uplink
representor is linked.

Starting from kernel 5.8 due to new change [1] the PF and VF representors are
linked to their parent PCI device, and so "get_ifname_by_pci_address" fails
to get the correct UpLink Representor.

This patch modifys the behviour of "get_ifname_by_pci_address" to
check the physical port name of the netdev in
vf_pci_addr_path/physfn/net to match the formart for the uplink "p\d+".

[1] https://git.kernel.org/pub/scm/linux/kernel/git/netdev/net.git/commit/?id=123f0f53dd64b67e34142485fe866a8a581f12f1

Closes-Bug: #1892132
Change-Id: I49f6ae3f0e6bfbf555c8284bfd70371ce90da0c7

commit_message:
Remove the unused coding style modules

Python modules related to coding style checks (listed in blacklist.txt in
openstack/requirements repo) are dropped from lower-constraints.txt
they are not needed during installation.

Change-Id: Id735af397e8d41ad3ff583386844d4131fc9e12c

commit_message:
Fix error that instance could not be found

The instance may have been deleted when calling 'force_delete_server'.
So this patch ignores exception 'lib_exc.NotFound' that avoid
error in tearing down stage.

Change-Id: I29d6d1a41e3fb1bbbdb1f16ef4e54916df2e1ec7
Closes-Bug: #1896865

> Just question:
 > in https://pip.pypa.io/en/stable/reference/pip_install/
 > anything you missed in your requirements file—and it’s easy to miss
 > things as your project evolves. To be safe, install your project
 > using pip and --no-deps.
 > 
 > but `-U` Upgrade all specified packages to the newest available
 > version. The handling of dependencies depends on the
 > upgrade-strategy used.
 > does that mean it will get newest version

The U (upgrade) might be redundant to be honest, the intent was to make sure that it always installs the latest version of Designate, while the --no_deps prevents it from installing any of the Designate dependencies, since that is handled before.'}, {'account_id': 22623, 'date': '2020-10-22 01:20:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Fix lower-constraints test not constraining properly

When running the lower-constraints test we are currently
using pip install -e . to install the source. This caused
python libraries to unintentionally getting upgraded beyond
the intended constraints.

Change-Id: Ie05efab2f52fe3e1641c9863f6f85c813158e748
(cherry picked from commit 568b559b67b0d9a663172d681fe887bf06feea0a)

commit_message:
Set safe version of hacking

Versions of hacking from 3.1.0 until 4.0.0 NOT included are supposed
to require a safe version of flake8, so besides normale issues related
to minor version upgrades, we can safely use those versions.
Also forcing pycodestyle versions to be compatible with flake8 installed
by hacking.

Change-Id: I3573f9d360450eaa204f5e951fc9e56592c77af2

commit_message:
Force local connection for localhost

Starting with Ansible 2.9.10, the "Collecting node facts" task in
bifrost-configdrives-dynamic can fail because it tries to SSH to
localhost, which may not be possible in some environments, such as
Bifrost deployed as a container by Kolla.

Change-Id: I1ed19e325db9396ff6b250e14c967ce90c785201
Story: 2008260
Task: 41118

[{'account_id': 32541, 'date': '2020-10-15 22:28:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2020-10-15 22:28:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Congratulations, you've proposed your first change in OpenDev.

Your submission will now be tested automatically by Zuul, our gatekeeper,
and reviewed by other friendly developers. They will give you feedback and
may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches often take days (and sometimes weeks) to get reviewed, so be
patient. Don't hesitate to ask for help, and answer questions about your
work promptly if you can. The more you get to know reviewers and get to be
known by them, the smoother the review and approval process will become. The
fastest way to accomplish this is by reviewing other proposed changes
yourself: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for participating in OpenDev, we look forward to seeing you
around.

commit_message:
Change auth type to none in dev-quickstart

The OS_AUTH_TYPE=token_endpoint plugin has been removed from Keystoneauth1
Setting that value as an envvar triggers a stack trace when performing
baremetal driver list

Change-Id: Ieb9c12f29c2f4df1ba89b792442e1768c8aee8a4

commit_message:
WIP:Fix bug in PingMonitor FT

This patch fixes a bug that causes one of the following tests
 to fail in the PingMonitor functional-test.
(It is not certain which test will fail.)

This bug was caused by a problem in the way VNF checks
state transitions, so change the checking method.

- test_vnf_monitoring_with_vdu_autoheal_action_for_multi_vdu
- test_vnf_monitoring_with_vdu_autoheal_action_for_single_vdu

subject: Add release notes links for Victoria release
messages:
[{'account_id': 28654, 'date': '2020-10-21 13:07:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-10-21 13:10:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2

Hello,

First, thanks for your help on this topic.

Notice that this kind of changes are leaded by a specific process:
1. projects should have merged a specific patch before adding this link (c.f the list of patch not yet merged https://review.opendev.org/#/q/topic:reno-victoria+(status:open))
2. after that we us a specific command to generate a single one patch to land these release notes.

Also notice that:
- your proposed links lead to a non existing page (404).
- a single one patch could be enough to manage this kind of change and also to avoid to waste serverals CI executions.'}, {'account_id': 28654, 'date': '2020-10-21 13:10:54.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}, {'account_id': 28654, 'date': '2020-10-22 01:05:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Hello,
 > 
 > First, thanks for your help on this topic.
 > 
 > Notice that this kind of changes are leaded by a specific process:
 > 1. projects should have merged a specific patch before adding this
 > link (c.f the list of patch not yet merged https://review.opendev.org/#/q/topic:reno-victoria+(status:open))
 > 2. after that we us a specific command to generate a single one
 > patch to land these release notes.
 > 
 > Also notice that:
 > - your proposed links lead to a non existing page (404).
 > - a single one patch could be enough to manage this kind of change
 > and also to avoid to waste serverals CI executions.

thank you'}]

commit_message:
Ensure sysstat package is installed

The change-id, I71355b8501047d4b956f66a5025e70058d7ce0bc, introduced
sysstat package into the overcloud image. However, it won't affect to
the existing deploymennt. This commit ensures that sysstat package is
installed in the overcloud nodes.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/747077/
Change-Id: Ib37b62bf21b502cb69d4fd77aa23b9525a6d5a7b

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-07-21 11:44:33.000000000', 'message': 'Add pre-commit

pre-commit will be used to:
- trailing whitespace [1].
- Replaces or checks mixed line ending (mixed-line-ending) [1].
- Forbid files which have a UTF-8 byte-order
  marker (check-byte-order-marker) [1].
- Checks that non-binary executables have a proper
  shebang (check-executables-have-shebangs) [1].
- Check for files that contain merge conflict
  strings (check-merge-conflict) [1].
- Check for debugger imports and py37+ breakpoint()
  calls in python source (debug-statements) [1].

[{'created': '2020-10-14 15:57:18.000000000', 'message': 'Fix "Wait for the ironic node to be inspected" task

Variables to customise hardware inspection timeouts were introduced in
change I2e45876f89121d66cf03b50824bd8258517b88cb. Unfortunately, the
wait_inspected_timeout variable is turned into a string despite
inspector_inspection_timeout being originally defined as an integer,
causing the following error:

Unexpected templating type error occurred on ({{ wait_inspected_timeout // wait_inspected_interval }}): unsupported operand type(s) for //: 'str' and 'int'

Change-Id: Ie40a3eed7146e2e2d8b1c08860da395b35ed99d6
Story: 2007844
Task: 40135
'}]
commit_message:
Fix "Wait for the ironic node to be inspected" task

Variables to customise hardware inspection timeouts were introduced in
change I2e45876f89121d66cf03b50824bd8258517b88cb. Unfortunately, the
wait_inspected_timeout variable is turned into a string despite
inspector_inspection_timeout being originally defined as an integer,
causing the following error:

Unexpected templating type error occurred on ({{ wait_inspected_timeout // wait_inspected_interval }}): unsupported operand type(s) for //: 'str' and 'int'

Change-Id: Ie40a3eed7146e2e2d8b1c08860da395b35ed99d6
Story: 2007844
Task: 40135

commit_message:
Fix lower-constraints test not constraining properly

When running the lower-constraints test we are currently
using pip install -e . to install the source. This caused
python libraries to unintentionally getting upgraded beyond
the intended constraints.

Change-Id: Ie05efab2f52fe3e1641c9863f6f85c813158e748
(cherry picked from commit 568b559b67b0d9a663172d681fe887bf06feea0a)

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/1.1.x

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/1.1.x branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I7a9004e60698d1698e2495ec07174b15eef88815

commit_message:
Remove the unused coding style modules

Python modules related to coding style checks (listed in blacklist.txt in
openstack/requirements repo) are dropped from lower-constraints.txt
they are not needed during installation.

Change-Id: Id08d82ccfa2336b2990fa93a1a56735cd10aa745

commit_message:
Add missing dependencies about keystone_puppet_config

The keystone_puppet_config should be generated during configuration
phase, otherwise some resources which requires access to Keystone
api fails.

Change-Id: Iba6b8b16a2aa5e9a8ebbcc297f659767a5ce64af

commit_message:
virt: Remove 'get_console_pool_info' API

This is no longer used by any in-tree virt drivers and can be removed.
The equivalent RPC API now always raises 'NotImplementedError', which
was the behavior with virt drivers that didn't support the feature.

Change-Id: Iab881ef4f52eff4815e781f10204497968f8a06b
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
