commit_message:
Add possibility to set logging source for Horizon

This patch adds HorizonLoggingSource parameter to enable fluentd to tail logs
from Horizon.

To keep consistency with other services the default value is set as single log located
in appropriate log directory, but we also need to enable customer to pass multiple
horizon log files also used by httpd.

Change-Id: I0161e6d9c76424b301e48b73f1d7b4b071af0676

commit_message:
Squashed backport for 'NovaAllowResizeToSameHost' parameter

We squashed the backports because the first patch wasn't right, so for
full history we backports the 2 patches in the same time.

1) Add 'NovaAllowResizeToSameHost' parameter

This parameter is used quite often but is not currently exposed in THT.
Close that gap. This is used by the API so it is that container that's
modified.

Change-Id: Idb56d7e2fd741b3d0dfaa8fd376ebe6d6ae8b867
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 0b63621a5e40d53166fe8a5625236bed82e1b3f4)

2) Fix allow_resize_to_same_host

allow_resize_to_same_host is in nova::api class, not ::nova.

commit_message:
Add ability to manage irqbalance on compute per role

Adds functionality whether to enable/disable irqbalance on compute
nodes.
Based on tuning recommendation for compute realtime nodes irqbalance
should be stopped and disabled. And tuned will be responsible for
managing IRQ balancing instead of irqbalance.

Conflicts:
      deployment/nova/nova-compute-container-puppet.yaml

Change-Id: Ibefb8e472c68901a74d76769b5314bef81fd5b15
(cherry picked from commit 932aecf33c617b97f399d4b197beae7d68fa104c)

commit_message:
Add ability to manage irqbalance on compute per role

Adds functionality whether to enable/disable irqbalance on compute
nodes.
Based on tuning recommendation for compute realtime nodes irqbalance
should be stopped and disabled. And tuned will be responsible for
managing IRQ balancing instead of irqbalance.

commit_message:
Add ability to manage irqbalance on compute per role

Adds functionality whether to enable/disable irqbalance on compute
nodes.
Based on tuning recommendation for compute realtime nodes irqbalance
should be stopped and disabled. And tuned will be responsible for
managing IRQ balancing instead of irqbalance.

Change-Id: Ibefb8e472c68901a74d76769b5314bef81fd5b15

commit_message:
undercloud: disable placement api by default

When nova was disabled by default, we forgot to disable placement api as
well, which isn't required anymore on the Undercloud, since Ironic
doesn't use Placement API to place hw resources.

Change-Id: I48938cabf218179078c9c2d76e2d67a7c435b502

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-09-22 23:21:08.000000000', 'message': 'Refactor OVNMacAddressNetwork

Move the OVNMacAddressNetwork resource out of the
Networks resource. This is a special network that
we want to create internally.

Having this network nested in the Networks resource
interfer with the work related to creating composable
networks with non-heat tooling.

Change-Id: I5551af42bc87fb8489edbfbd2abadba3dca30b0b
'}]
commit_message:
Refactor OVNMacAddressNetwork

Move the OVNMacAddressNetwork resource out of the
Networks resource. This is a special network that
we want to create internally.

Having this network nested in the Networks resource
interfer with the work related to creating composable
networks with non-heat tooling.

Change-Id: I5551af42bc87fb8489edbfbd2abadba3dca30b0b

Use native ansible for nic configuration

This changes rest of the environments to use native ansible
nic configuration.

- net-bond-with-vlans.j2.yaml
- net-dpdkbond-with-vlans.j2.yaml
- net-single-nic-linux-bridge-with-vlans.j2.yaml

Change-Id: Ib88bdd7a2ae314205d235b15995449854088d342

commit_message:
Disable notification from services by default

Currently we disable Telemetry services like Ceilometer by defaut,
which means that we don't have any consumers for notification messages.
So NotificationDriver should be set as noop by default so that we don't
have unconsumed messages in notification queues.

Change-Id: I1d05749c94bd58ad4badafa7d9755009cb4b64af
Closes-Bug: #1869355

subject: Use native ansible for nic configuration in some envs
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 8833, 'name': 'Rabi Mishra', 'email': 'ramishra@redhat.com', 'username': 'rabi'}, {'_account_id': 12398, 'name': 'Dan Sneddon', 'email': 'dsneddon@redhat.com', 'username': 'dsneddon'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 18575, 'name': 'Saravanan KR', 'email': 'krsacme@gmail.com', 'username': 'saravanankr'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 24245, 'name': 'Harald Jensås', 'email': 'hjensas@redhat.com', 'username': 'harald.jensas'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2020-10-02 07:27:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2020-10-02 07:51:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2020-10-02 08:03:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2020-10-02 08:16:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2020-10-02 08:35:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Yeah this is still WIP.'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2020-10-07 03:34:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> This does'nt take into accound that different ansible templates are used for different roles? For example storage.

@Harald,

I guess you wanted us to use tags instead of role.name when specifying templates for role types. I don't see us using tags for role types atm and probably won't be backward compatible. Can you please clarify before I update these patches to use the new templates?"}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2020-10-07 10:01:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> > This does'nt take into accound that different ansible templates
 > are used for different roles? For example storage.
 > 
 > @Harald,
 > 
 > I guess you wanted us to use tags instead of role.name when
 > specifying templates for role types. I don't see us using tags for
 > role types atm and probably won't be backward compatible. Can you
 > please clarify before I update these patches to use the new
 > templates?

I'm not sure I clarify, a long response. I see two options and tried to explain them below.
We use role.name in many places, and we should try to move away from that. The latter part discus a bit other places we have role.name logic as well.


With the heat templates we render one template per-role from one jinja2 template.
The heat jinja2 templates use a mix of role.name and tags today.

Currently we use tag 'external_bridge'[1] in heat nic templates to control if br-ex should be created or not.
In other places we use role.name, for example [2] for Dpdk and [3] for storage.

I'm not sure if it's better to keep the env simple and have just one template, and do all the logic there. Or the model chosen now to have a 'storage' and a 'dpdk' specific template and refer to different templates based on role in env. The anti-pattern of using names is that it does not work with custom names. My idea is to use a role tag as the hint.

So for roles: CephStorage, ObjectStorage, BlockStorage we add a tag in role_data, ie:

  - name: <ROLE_NAME>
    tags:
      - storage

And replace:
 {%- if role.name.startswith('CephStorage') or role.name.startswith('ObjectStorage') %}
with:
 {%- if 'storage' in role.tags %}

Same thing for dpdk, we add a tag

  - name: <ROLE_NAME>
    tags:
      - dpdk

And replace:
 {%- if not role.name.startswith('ComputeOvsDpdk') %}
with:
 {%- if 'dpdk' in role.tags %}



Another option would be to put these things into the 'networks' dict in roles data.
Currently it's format is:

  networks:
    InternalApi:
      subnet: internal_api_subnet
    Storage:
      subnet: storage_subnet

I started work[4] a while ago to improve things for resolve network and qdr metric network where I extend that dict. In that patch I extend the 'networks' dict to:

  networks:
    ctlplane: {}
    InternalApi:
      subnet: internal_api_subnet
      resolve_net: true
      metrics_qdr_net: true

I then replace the use of "if role.name <ROLE_NAME>" in network/service_net_map.j2.yaml. (An alternative for that patch would be to have 'resolve_net: <NET_NAME>' and 'metrics_qdr_net: <NET_NAME> at level-0 for the role ...)


I'm not sure, could be extending the networks dict to consolidate data such as 'bridge_name', a 'nic_mapping' hint?, 'resolve_net', 'metrics_qdr_net' and move the 'default_route_network' to be a bool in that dict would be a good approach long term. OR, consoldating like this seems logical to _me_ is just plain added complexity for _others_. :)


FWIW, tag's seem like the easy approach?
We will break backward compatibility, but we can avoid issues either by starting to do schema validating of role's data and require atleast one tag to be present, to ensure anyone upgrading with a dated roles file get's a validation error they need to fix before the upgrade can proceed. Or use the raise extension[5] that I made for [4] in THT jinja2 templating so that errors are raised with a message telling the user to add the now required tags.


[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/src/branch/master/network/config/multiple-nics/role.role.j2.yaml#L158
[2] https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/src/branch/master/network/config/multiple-nics/role.role.j2.yaml#L194
[3] https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/src/branch/master/network/config/single-nic-vlans/role.role.j2.yaml#L116
[4] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/726758/4/roles/ComputeSriov.yaml
[5] https://review.opendev.org/726756'}, {'account_id': 18575, 'date': '2020-10-08 07:03:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I agree to using tag to identify than the role name. Ideally, it should have been identified based on the service (like "OS::TripleO::Services::ComputeNeutronOvsDpdk" for identying DPDK, but at the time of jinja rendering, we will not know wtherther the service is enabled or not). So, tags look like a better approach.

Upgrades will be an issue as we have to find a way to force user to align the role definitions of their local roles_data.yaml with upstream roles. For DPDK, generally the multi-nic templates will be used as reference and users will modify their templates as per cluster needs in most cases. So, its OK modify DPDK role name to tags.'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2020-10-13 08:16:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2020-10-13 15:50:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2020-10-14 02:05:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2020-10-14 14:02:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2020-10-14 14:17:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2020-10-15 04:39:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2020-10-15 07:15:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5: Patch Set 4 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2020-10-15 07:29:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6: Patch Set 5 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2020-10-15 07:35:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2020-10-15 13:36:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2020-10-21 13:25:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

CHECKED'}]

commit_message:
Use native ansible for nic configuration in some envs

This changes the following environments
- net-multiple-nics.j2.yaml
- net-multiple-nics-vlans.j2.yaml
- net-single-nic-with-vlans.j2.yaml
- net-single-nic-with-vlans-no-external.j2.yaml

Change-Id: I4713ffc15c9be0f303790ae29910f7d2738cfae8

commit_message:
Make NovaLibvirtOptVolumes role specific

Since it's common for users to deploy multiple types of compute nodes,
we should make the opt volumes role specific to allow for customization
based on the role being deployed.

Change-Id: Ie9d68fe1a0c3e05c7fc31c3fea79d6019281886b
Related-Bug: #1897265

commit_message:
Make NovaLibvirtOptVolumes role specific

Since it's common for users to deploy multiple types of compute nodes,
we should make the opt volumes role specific to allow for customization
based on the role being deployed.

Conflicts:
      deployment/nova/nova-libvirt-container-puppet.yaml

Change-Id: Ie9d68fe1a0c3e05c7fc31c3fea79d6019281886b
Related-Bug: #1897265
(cherry picked from commit 5d0f624d87abfac88fc4ae437c1728fc415a2b5d)
(cherry picked from commit 76e3a6880687a06d6d37cb089e35dc5d18aeeaca)

commit_message:
Make NovaLibvirtOptVolumes role specific

Since it's common for users to deploy multiple types of compute nodes,
we should make the opt volumes role specific to allow for customization
based on the role being deployed.

Change-Id: Ie9d68fe1a0c3e05c7fc31c3fea79d6019281886b
Related-Bug: #1897265
(cherry picked from commit 5d0f624d87abfac88fc4ae437c1728fc415a2b5d)

commit_message:
Enforce internal api for token verification

This change enforces the usage of internal api for token verification,
so that internal requests to keystone uses internal endpoint instead
of admin endpoint which is deployed on provisioning network by default.

Change-Id: I8b5ac36ff1da46844d18fa73f835175e52719a63
Closes-Bug: #1899266

commit_message:
Enable glance sparse image upload

To handle sparse image upload, new config parameters
``rbd_thin_provisioning`` and ``filesystem_thin_provisioning``
have been added in glance for rbd and filesystem backends
respectively with enabling image_conversion plugin for both
types of backends.

To make the above parameters enable, adding 'GlanceSparseUploadEnabled'
parameter in THT.

Depends-On: Ic95fa45af0f1db92d8425862c6267f466764fbbe
Depends-On: I90c8ea98a96fa57f5bf3bf0c6b2b37ec95474baf

Partially Implements: blueprint handle-sparse-image

Change-Id: I5a339e9850be3825540873736b9734178994ce21

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-19 08:49:29.000000000', 'message': "Ensure name consistency for tmpfiles.d configurations

Following change Iaced2ba676a4e4f651c67da082797cc1c1ffccd1, this patch
adds a new task for the update/upgrades steps in order to ensure we're
in a clean state, with consistent names.

Change-Id: I9f069332254d057f80e3d25e9f8b734f8a592810
"}, {'created': '2020-06-19 12:14:59.000000000', 'message': "Ensure name consistency for tmpfiles.d configurations

Following change Iaced2ba676a4e4f651c67da082797cc1c1ffccd1, this patch
adds a new task for the update/upgrades steps in order to ensure we're
in a clean state, with consistent names.

This patch also add a potential missing ffwd_tasks for redis, and avoid
code duplication using yaml anchors.

Change-Id: I9f069332254d057f80e3d25e9f8b734f8a592810
"}, {'created': '2020-06-19 12:16:38.000000000', 'message': "Ensure name consistency for tmpfiles.d configurations

Following change Iaced2ba676a4e4f651c67da082797cc1c1ffccd1, this patch
adds a new task for the update/upgrades/ffwd steps in order to ensure we're
in a clean state, with consistent names.

This patch also adds a potential missing ffwd_tasks for redis, and

commit_message:
Ensure name consistency for tmpfiles.d configurations

Following change Iaced2ba676a4e4f651c67da082797cc1c1ffccd1, this patch
adds a new task for the update/upgrades steps in order to ensure we're
in a clean state, with consistent names.

It also takes the opportunity to chase down newly added /var/run
mentions.

Change-Id: I9f069332254d057f80e3d25e9f8b734f8a592810

This changes deployed-server-environment.j2.yaml to not use

[{'created': '2020-10-10 20:25:56.000000000', 'message': 'Use `undercloud` instead of `Undercloud` when delegating tasks

If ansible detects uppercase characters in delegate_to, it assumes the
target is a grou, not a host.

We should use all lowercase representation (e.g., `undercloud`) so that
ansible does the right thing and looks for the host, instead of looking
for the `Undercloud` group.

Change-Id: If31e620b88830ef85a2bddaccd6cd7064cce4472
(cherry picked from commit ac916a38c6e70926b854b0e5c9249423f860a1ab)

commit_message:
Use `undercloud` instead of `Undercloud` when delegating tasks

If ansible detects uppercase characters in delegate_to, it assumes the
target is a grou, not a host.

We should use all lowercase representation (e.g., `undercloud`) so that
ansible does the right thing and looks for the host, instead of looking
for the `Undercloud` group.

Change-Id: If31e620b88830ef85a2bddaccd6cd7064cce4472
(cherry picked from commit ac916a38c6e70926b854b0e5c9249423f860a1ab)

commit_message:
Use `undercloud` instead of `Undercloud` when delegating tasks

If ansible detects uppercase characters in delegate_to, it assumes the
target is a grou, not a host.

We should use all lowercase representation (e.g., `undercloud`) so that
ansible does the right thing and looks for the host, instead of looking
for the `Undercloud` group.

Change-Id: If31e620b88830ef85a2bddaccd6cd7064cce4472

commit_message:
Quote lookup var

Since the key includes colons, we need to quote it so yaml stops trying
to interpret it as an element.

Change-Id: I04c24936bbff9f9ceea72f71e6e7798b4a2a39aa
Closes-Bug: #1898113

commit_message:
Remove mount for tripleo-validations from mistral containers

openstack-tripleo-validations datadir no longer exists
post movement to /usr/share/ansible with [1], remove
no longer needed bind mount from mistral containers.

[1] I62e36f4ab7a77b5120e014dc61168a1ccc9fc6e0

Closes-Bug: #1898931
Change-Id: If796b5eb81c9287141e04d24685b66e1cfe81964

Network config with ansible for ci jobs using multi-nics

ansible.

commit_message:
Deprecate Mistral services

Mistral services aren't used anymore on the Undercloud and we never saw
users on the Overcloud.
For simplification purpose, let's deprecate it so we can reduce our
number of containers and services in TripleO.

Change-Id: I422766fbdfa5d8728477d2b0d2b1d46a90f631ae

commit_message:
Return details in output of container health check

This patch reformats check-container-health script for sensubility to output
json formatted data instead of semi-colon separated data. Removes calculation
of duration for each container HC to keep the runtime shorter.

Change-Id: I18bcde4b6031c79deae3f6c9ee6f2c4bb754be88

commit_message:
Return details in output of container health check

This patch reformats check-container-health script for sensubility to output
json formatted data instead of semi-colon separated data. Removes calculation
of duration for each container HC to keep the runtime shorter.

Change-Id: I18bcde4b6031c79deae3f6c9ee6f2c4bb754be88
(cherry picked from commit f84655ed550f59580628646e158ca23585a13b63)

commit_message:
Check for network in role.networks for resolve and qdr

In https://review.opendev.org/722241 the service net map
HostnameResolveNetwor was fixed for roles that don't have
the InternalApi network. This follows up and fixes the
same issue for MetricsQdrNetwork and Ceph roles as well.

Also re-factor the jinja2 to iterate only once over the
roles.

Related-Bug: #1874330
Change-Id: Iff0e30a6c52fea75449dbd228dec45f708036f9f

commit_message:
Set safe version of hacking

Versions of hacking from 3.1.0 until 4.0.0 NOT included are supposed
to require a safe version of flake8, so besides normale issues related
to minor version upgrades, we can safely use those versions.
Also forcing pycodestyle versions to be compatible with flake8 installed
by hacking.

Change-Id: I9230afbaa70afcfb4b21a4598d534143ce6a6f96

commit_message:
Greater flexibility to timer templating

Allows for the combining of multiple directives of the same type as
the spec allows. An options value can now be specified as a list.
Particularly useful for specifying multiple onCalendar directives.

Change-Id: I2f0408a47861560b7813eeba7b3f2ce682823e1e

the container image names that pacemaker uses to set up the HA

commit_message:
HA: option to use static pacemaker image name

With [1] we added the ability to use a fixed, static prefix for
the container image names that pacemaker uses to set up the HA
resources. This name is just an alias to the real tripleo
image that is being used in the control plane, and it allows to
update the namespace part of the image during a minor update
without disrupting service.

Add a new Heat parameter to use a completely static container
image name, to allow arbitrary name change during minor update,
e.g. registryA/namespaceA/imgA:tagA to registryB/namespaceB/imgB:tagB
By default, this new paramter is disabled.

[1] Id369154d147cd5cf0a6f997bf806084fc7580e01

Change-Id: I124c1e4dbcc7a8ed38079411f41a8f31c8f62284
